  13. I received my Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer through a program run by Gillette. I was skeptical that a trimmer with such a small head and battery powered could do the job. I wound up being pleasantly surprised!<br /> The Trimmer comes with a handy stand, with little shelves in the back to hold the trimmer attachments. Since they are only shelves they can fall out when tilted but once you find a spot for the stand you shouldn't have to move it much. The stand doesn't take up much space on the counter or in the medicine cabinet.<br /> As to power, the ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer has it! Sideburns=gone in one pass. The blades to the trimmer are sharp and powerful. The handle itself is solid and has decent heft. It doesn't feel cheap or flimsy. The teeth on the combs seem a little fragile but if you use the trimmer for its intended purpose you shouldn't have any problems. I think this is meant to be used to frequently trim and manscape. For that purpose the ProGlide Power Trimmer works great: grab it, turn it on and do your thing. The power of this trimmer makes frequent trimming a breeze. If you let things go for a while, it'll take you a little longer and more effort. This trimmer isn't meant to handle the heavy stuff, just the everyday touchups.<br /> Care is easy: after use, rinse it off, dry it and put it in the stand.<br /> The razor itself is a Gillette Fusion head I'm familiar with and have used frequently. Having it attached to the trimmer makes it longer than a regular razor handle so it felt strange as I shaved. I didn't feel I got as close as I would with a normal Gillette razor but that may change as I get accustomed to the longer handle. As an added bonus the handle accepts a razor blade that fits on any Gillette Fusion, Fusion ProGlide, or Fusion ProGlide Power handle.<br /> A razor and trimmer for under $20 with the quality of Gillette is a good buy. Right now there's even a $3.00 coupon making the decision that much easier.

  15. I received the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler through a program run by Gillette and have been absolutely thrilled with it. I had been looking to replace an old trimmer I had that the battery would no longer hold a charge. So far this has been an awesome replacement. Starting off with the cons, there are really only three complaints that I have with it. First, the trimmer head is a bit narrower than I would like, although that does allow more precise cutting. Second, the angle you have to hold it to get the best cut possible is different than any other trimmer I have used, but it DOES allow for a better view of what you are cutting. Third, the power button does take a bit of playing with to figure out how to get it clicked in the whole way (may have just been mine). But on the plus sides, it is extremely well constructed overall. Feels very sturdy and works great in the shower. While it has no problem cutting thicker hair, it is still gentle enough to not bother sensitive skin on face or body. The blade attachment is also a very nice touch to be able to use fusion blades on it as well. All around a great trimmer and I would gladly recommend it to anyone I know.

I love the ergonomics and the way it fits in my hand, but it is also too large to fit in my mirror mounted razor holder and takes up a larger footprint then a regular razor.   61. I was pretty excited to have got this item free via a promotion from Gillette. The very stylish package Contained: 1 Trimmer, 1 ProGlide Power Cartridge, 3 combs, 1 battery, and an organizer. After having done so, I decided that I would be using the #2 Comb to get the look I was after. The trimmer handle is quite a bit smaller than my Phillips and the trimming head is also smaller. This made the trimming on my face and body take a bit longer than I was used to. However, it did trim my facial hair evenly and easily. I followed up with out a comb guard to attempt to get that precise edge on my neck and lip line. It preformed flawlessly and with the smaller head than my Phillips the tighter places were slightly easier to get to. I also used the Proglide cartridge to shave up the neck area and my upper cheek. I was really impressed with it. While on the trimmer the Proglide vibrates slightly giving a noticeably comfortable shave. It can be used in the shower, which is nice, but, I didn't use it this way at first. I do plan on trying it out there too, something my Phillips cannot do.<br /><br />Overall, I like this trimmer, it is slim and sleek looking. I was concerned that it wouldn't give me the look I am after but, it did so quite nicely. It doesn't have as many settings as my other trimmer but, for the price, it is a great option. With the smaller size, battery power, and integrated razor I see myself using this as a travel trimmer. I feel this is a great entry level trimmer that would always be a good standby.<br /><br />After reading another review, I would say if it has been a while since you manscaped, you might want to bring out the big guns, this trimmer is a perfect light duty tool.

  75. I have always been a fan of Gillette products so when I had the opportunity to try out this free &#34;styler&#34; as a part of a program run by Gillette, I immediately jumped on the opportunity. My first impression when opening the package was how sleek the device was. It had a very modern look! But what I really liked was how close of a shave it gave me! The vibrating tool in the styler helped stimulate the hairs on my face and chest so that it gave me an incredibly smooth shave. Better yet was how well it worked in the shower! I always shave in the shower, so I was a little hesitant at first with a more electric type razor, but this one blew me away! The hairs fell off the blade with no problem and it consistently trimmed the hairs on my face and chest regardless of how I was moving the styler.   76. I recently had the privilege to try out the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer through a program that is run by Gillette. This trimmer works great! It deserves a slot in your morning routine. The trimmer comes with three different size attachments to cover most facial hair needs. This trimmer can handle any facial forest. I have thick and course facial hair, and the trimmer handled it without any struggle. The trimmer head is a good size. It's about an inch in diameter which should cover all your trimming needs. The trimmer itself is very easy to handle. The grip feels almost like tire tread, which means a good slip free grip. That is any guys nightmare. Putting the finishing touches to whatever style that you just created and the trimmer slips leaving you with something that Boy George would like. That won't happen with this one. The power trimmer is also shower friendly! For me it wasn't really a big deal. I'm not the type to trim my face in the shower. The good thing I found with this was when I am trimming, and can wash it off in the sink while using it! That equals less facial trimmings landing on my chest or worse in the crevasse of my elbow. Nothing is worse then getting a facial hair sliver, yes this has happened before! After using the trimmer the head pops about a quarter inch back so the inside can be cleaned. The trimmer uses one AA battery to keep it going. It is very easy to replace. Unscrew the bottom of the trimmer and there is the battery. It would be better if it was rechargeable, but you can't have everything. Another feature that I really liked was the case it came in. It has a slot for everything, and isn't cumbersome or oversized at all. The three size attachments have slots in the back of the case where they fit snuggly as not to come out unless wanted. The front holds the trimmer upright, and behind the Fusion Razor cartridge attachment. The case is neat and actually looks good on the bathroom counter! Over all this trimmer is great! This trimmer will keep any style easy to manage and maintain! Another great product from Gillette!

I would say if you are one who needs to shave everyday or once a week and likes to keep their goatee trimmed neatly, this trimmer is for you. Not only does it save you time, but it is quick and easy to change from shaver to trimmer without any hassle.   94. Because I always keep stubble on my face and keep the rest of my body pretty well groomed, I was looking forward to trying the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer. (Gillette kindly provided me with one so I could see how well it performs.)<br /><br />Overall, I don't love it. It works pretty well for precision trimming on the face, but it's not as multifunctional as it aspires to be.<br /><br />To start the experience, one must open the package and get the trimmer out, which takes a solid five minutes of undistracted focus. At best, it's complicated. When you finally assemble the contents, the small flimsy rack in front of you holding a tiny trimmer and a few hastily designed attachments is an anticlimax.<br /><br />On to actually using it. Like I mentioned, I use trimmers for stubble. The device I normally use can alter the length by .2mm at a time. This is not that. The trimmer blade on its own cuts very short leaving almost nothing (good for cleaning up around a beard), while the shortest attachment leaves too much to look clean and maintained.<br /><br />The attachments would be better served for body hair, but that must also be fairly precision oriented due to the small size of the trimmer. Useful for underarms and one's personal area, but for the chest or larger spots, the process is too time-consuming. I also found the trimmer blade not to be quite sharp enough. A couple times it got a little caught in my beard but that may be user error.<br /><br />I tried the razor blade attachment for a moment but there's just something about vibrating razors on my neck that scares me. A regular razor with as many blades is likely just as good without the buzzing.<br /><br />Overall, if you're looking for a compact device that does precise trimming of small areas and can get wet in the shower, this is a pretty good choice. If you're after a stubble or body hair trimmer, look for something bigger with better attachments.

I'm not sure the vibration while using the manual shaver makes any difference, but it feels nice. The best part is that if something happened to this, I wouldn't think twice about buying a new one--more than I can say for much more expensive &#34;all in one&#34; alternatives (which were also bulky and involved swapping out multiple heads). One criticism: having only three comb sizes is a bit limiting. You'd better hope your preferred beard length matches one of the three, or you're SOL. EDIT: I still really like this thing, but the blades are of course super expensive. It's like buying a cheap electric toothbrush and then realizing the brush heads cost way more than they should. That's clearly where Gillette is making their money.

  144. I was recently provided the Gillette Fusion Proglide Styler as part of a program run by Gillette. I have owned several trimmers that are able to shave and trim but for me, this product does both better than most.<br /><br />I spend about 70% of my weeks on the road for work, and that means a lot of time living out of luggage. Any time I can save some space and make it easier to pack things I get excited. This styler appealed to me instantly because I wouldn't need to pack the handle to my Pro Glide, and it was more compact than the electric trimmer I usually pack.<br /><br />As a user of the Pro Glide products, I was already familiar with the cartridges and how effective thay are for close shaving. They work well on the face or off the face... I'll post a more detailed review of the cartridges in that product area.<br /><br />The electric styler is pretty foolproof and is great for the things it is designed to do. Bear in mind that there are limited guards and you do not have infinite adjustment like you would find with some other options, but if the size you need is included, you will be all set. For me, I use the large guard for my goatee and sideburns, and the straight trimmer to edge my lines and make sure my moustache is trimmed around my lips. I've done the maintenance on my facial hair about a half dozen times so far and the battery is still going strong.<br /><br />The battery option is another thing to take note of. I pack a couple of spare batteries for my gadgets and stuff anyways so being able to pop out an old battery and swap in a new one to keep on going is appealing to me. No waiting for a charge, and never need to worry about a cord.<br /><br />I can't comment on the storage solution that comes with the styler, because it hasn't been used. I tossedthe styler into my toiletry bag and it hasn't come out since... but it has been to three countries :)<br /><br />I thought for the price advertised that an extra battery or cartridge would have been nice. You can get battery trimmers for around the same quality but a little cheaper. I will suggest this product to my friends though, since it combines two essential products most men rely on regularly and you really do get best of both worlds... the closeness of a real razor without screens or foils, and the horsepower of an electric trimmer in a compact package.You can get battery trimmers for around the same quality but a little cheaper. I will suggest this product to my friends though, since it combines two essential products most men rely on regularly and you really do get best of both worlds... the closeness of a real razor without screens or foils, and the horsepower of an electric trimmer in a compact package.

  155. This is the first kit that has let me use a manual razor without keeping the electric one around for trimming. It's easy cleaning, just pop the top open and spray with water. In fact, the section for the razor attachment even has a small hole cut out so you can put the razor away without messing up the lubrication stripe.<br /><br />I thought the size of this would make it awkward to hold and use, but i actually feel i have a better grip on it than the pencil-thin razor handles you usually get. The single \\"precision\\" blade on the back of the cartridge is not the face-shredder i thought it would be and lets me get in closer than the Schick precision-mode on their Hydro 5. The 5 blades on the front clog easy with hair and at first were hard to clean until i thought to blast hot water from the back. The precision blade can be a bit rough to clean though.<br /><br />I'm giving this 5 stars because the only thing that would disappoint me is if the expensive blades don't last long, but that will be reflected in their own review. This product fits its niche well and if you get it knowing that instead of thinking you've found a way to \\"beat the system\\" with an inexpensive product, you'll be just as happy as i am.<br /><br />This kit was given to me free because of a promotion that Gillette put on!

  167. While I received the razor via a Gillette program, I was surprised how well this little unit performed for the price point. They are not as convenient or adjustable as some more expensive trimmers I have used with one, dial-adjustable comb, but the three give you some level of choice.<br /><br />The plastic stand holds the various attachments, but they can (and often do) fall out of their assigned locations.<br /><br />In my opinion, the folks at Gillette should be including a travel bag with this unit and marketing it as a travel accessory instead of a full-use trimmer. It is a perfect size for this kind of use, and includes the standard razor head attachment so you can use it every day while on the road.

  203. Well I began with the [[ASIN:B003KWO3UI Gillette Fusion Proglide Manual 1 Up Razor]], then moved up to the [[ASIN:B003987CL0 Gillette Fusion Proglide Power Razor, 1-count Package]], then went out the other day and got this Styler. Not only can you use the same cartridges which snap onto the top, but the power shaving is phenomenal.<br /><br />The Braun trimmer has three snap-on combs (for hair lengths) as well as just using the trimmer alone for around the ears and sideburns. Plus you can pop on the proglide razor using the included special attachment to shave as well. After using the [[ASIN:B006DR2BO2 Schick Hydro 5 Power Select Razor]], I had more razor cuts than I've seen since I was a teenager. This was a new razor, a new cartridge, and the Schick left me bleeding in three places. That has NEVER happened with a Gillette razor product.<br /><br />As others have noted, it is a bit larger than a typical razor, but it's hardly heavy or cumbersome. I would not use the trimmer for cutting large swaths of hair as it's not intended for that. Beards, mustaches, short and curlies, and ears are all perfect for this trimmer. Anyone who's every gotten a haircut will recognize the trimmer for what it is: cleaning up around the edges.<br /><br />With that said, for the price you pay, the fact that the whole shebang is waterproof, and it's easy to manipulate, is backward compatible with fusion cartridges, makes this purchase a no-brainer. I got mine at CVS and paid much more than what it sells for on Amazon, so if I ever need another one I'll be getting it here. I'm just unhappy it doesn't have an attachment for nose hair!

  226. Good Evening,<br /><br />I realize that there have been a ton of reviews on this product recently, as I to was given a free sample by Gilette. I will start out by saying thank you and note that this may influence my review, so if it does in anyway please leave me a comment. Also, it would be great if you leave me a comment before giving me a thumbs down. Helpful comments help me, help you with better and more accurate reviews.<br /><br />Without further adieu, here goes. This set is extremely well packaged. It really is. It comes in this nice almost display like casing, nothing like I have ever seen before. Gillette sure knows how to make a grand impression and for that they must be applauded. Sure, it could be environmentally destructive, but the thick plastic casing serves as the perfect travel companion. In fact, I took this razor on a trip with me packaged in the box. It arrived with no damage, whatsover.<br /><br />As for the razor itself, it comes with three blades for trimming and one for a nice clean shave. The three blades are a great addition and make this ordinary shaving tool really interesting. You can literally customize your beard in all different shapes and sizes. It actually does a good job with hair on your head, if you really want to give that a shot. Switching out blades is easy, just push the button and the blade tool pops out. As for the battery, I have found it doesn't really much to enhance the trimming or the shaving, but that included functionality gives you additional customization. Much appreciated. Overall it's great, but this brings me to the downsides.<br /><br />The major pitfall and why this ended up with a 4 stars and not a perfect five is the razor blade itself. At least, when I first saw this, I felt that it's first and foremost a razor. Sadly that was the biggest let down for me. I have used other Gilettes and Schlicks and nothing has caused me this much itch in a shave. I was surprised and a bit stunned at what happened here. This is supposed to be the latest, yet at one point I thought I was bleeding. It's really a bit irritating and I would much rather just use a regular razor. With that being said, I think this is important, but not a deal breaker, as everyone has different preferences. I would try this blade on a different Gillette razor and see if it works for before jumping in on this amazing product.<br /><br />All in all, this product really is amazing. There is no getting past this that Gilette has helped to push the limits of an already overly saturated market and for that they should be applauded. It is really worth a second look.<br /><br />Once again thanks and remember comments do a lot more good than thumbs downs. Thank you for your understanding and look forward to addressing your complaints about my review.is is supposed to be the latest, yet at one point I thought I was bleeding. It's really a bit irritating and I would much rather just use a regular razor. With that being said, I think this is important, but not a deal breaker, as everyone has different preferences. I would try this blade on a different Gillette razor and see if it works for before jumping in on this amazing product.<br /><br />All in all, this product really is amazing. There is no getting past this that Gilette has helped to push the limits of an already overly saturated market and for that they should be applauded. It is really worth a second look.<br /><br />Once again thanks and remember comments do a lot more good than thumbs downs. Thank you for your understanding and look forward to addressing your complaints about my review.
  227. To preface: this review was written by my husband, as he used the trimmer. We share an account and he didn't want to create a new amazon account simply to review products when he could do it from our shared one.<br /><br />I received the Proglide trimmer free as part of a Gillette promotion. This product worked well for straightening sideburns. It is easy to use, trims nicely and closely and gets the job done quickly. I found it made my morning routine a lot faster, because of the efficiency of the product.<br /><br />The electric trimmer didn't shave through facial hair that well, in comparison to the sideburns, but it was convenient to have the razor in the same product for facial hair. It took a little time to get used to the thick handle for shaving, because it differs from the trimmer handles to other razors, but overall I like the Proglide trimmer. I continue using it in my daily routine, and think it's worth a try, especially for the detailing on sideburns and other 'manscaping' needs.
  228. I received the Styler free through a program run by Gillette. This was my first time using a power razor. It is a much smoother feeling shaving experience over a manual razor. For that alone, I recommended this over a manual razor. The trimmer attachments are easy to use and do a nice job at what they do. I like that the attachments are not very wide. It makes it easy to get under the arms and in my case I keep my eyebrows trimmed with it. The Styler comes with a holder to organize everything. It holds the handle nicely in the front and the blade on the top. In the back is where the comb attachments go. The wells for the combs are not very deep and in my opinion would benefit from a more sloped angle if they ever decide to redesign that. I just leave the combs sit out loose. This is not a reason for me to deduct any stars as it is just an extra piece.
  229. I received the Gillette Fusion Proglide Styler through a program run by Gillette.<br /><br />I've been trimming my facial hair with the same tools my barber uses for a few years and they work very well so my expectations for this styler were fairly low. It's actually decent.<br /><br />The 5 blade razor works well and I like the edger on the back when lining up my sideburns/hairline. At first it feels a bit odd to be using a razor with such a thick handle, but it doesn't make it unusable and just takes a little getting used to.<br /><br />The trimmer works. It just doesn't cut as easily as other tools and has a sorta slim width which makes grooming take longer. It's nice that the whole thing is waterproof when it comes to cleaning or if you feel the need to shave in the shower. Switching between attachments is very easy. I've used it about 4 times and the single AA battery is still going strong.<br /><br />I would recommend this product mostly as something handy to take with you on trips as it's compact, battery powered, and will get the job done at a good price.
  230. I was given this product as a sample and was amazed by it. I don't normally ''style'' my beard, but I found it very useful for trimming my sideburns and lightly trim my hair. I haven't tried trimming any body hair with it, but I suppose it would go smoothly, given it's power. It's compact, but powerful.<br />My favorite feature is that you can use the Gillette Proglide Power as a Razor, especially because of its thicker body, which makes it easier to grip while I'm shaving.
  231. All I can say is wow. I got this free razor via a program run by Gillette which was a great incentive to try it. Another great plus was that I was previously using the Gillete Fusion Proglide Power razor and had literally just went out and bought 8 replacement razors. If you've used this guy before, you know these blades are not cheap - and they worked in the Fusion Proglide! Sweet!<br /><br />The trimmer was amazing. I got a little carried away with it when I got it and started trimmer my finger hair - eeewww, but it worked so well! On top of that, I used the razor to shave and it seems to give a lot better result than my previous razor with the same blades. It came with 3 additional heads to trim any other facial hair. These are small and I was able to get a great, precise shave. My other trimmer was large and bulky and sometimes left behind some stragglers.. ALl in all, a great product! Especially for <$20!!!

The best part is that it works in the shower, which means no more hair on the bathroom floor (my wife really loves that)! I've used the trimmer on various parts of my body and it definitely did the job. The power trimmer is light-weight and thin, and a nice size to hold when shaving areas that a bit hard to get with other bulkier models that I've used in the past. The handle is ergonomic and doesn't slip out of your hands while wet. Cleaning the hair out of the razor is super easy and just takes seconds to rinse the opened trimmer door, under running water. Also, no need to charge, this trimmer is battery operated. All components of the razor come together in a packaged case, which makes it great when on the go or traveling. If you're looking for a power trimmer that doesn't break the bank and does what it promises, this is the trimmer for you.

I have to go back and forth over the same area 3-4x before I can trim all of the hairs down. The time that I thought I'd save with having the guides just turned into frustration as I went over the same area again and again until I finally used my comb/trimmer combo of old to finish the job.<br /><br />Dunno, if you have fine straight hair that needs trimming this might be your ticket... but my burly beard needs a trimmer with more behind it to make a difference.

So maybe this feature is not something that I absolutely needed, but I think it is better than actually buying a separate trimmer.<br /><br />Finally, I travel regularly for work so I would definitely not consider this as an option for traveling. It is heavy and thick and not ideal for packing among other items, especially if you bring the attachments. So, I'll stick to a more standard razor for traveling!

  286. I absolutely love this razor! I have been using it for weeks now and the battery is still going strong. I have used much more expensive packages from department stores and I think I get better results with the Proglide! It has yet to give me razor burn or scratch up my face and my skin is pretty sensitive. My wife used it on my son to give him a buzz cut for summer baseball season and to trim up both of our sideburns. I tend to keep my facial hair to a minimum with usually just a flavor savor so I cannot comment on Santa Claus beards and 20 year old mustache trimmings, but for my purposes it works great!

Attachments come on and off easily. The design of how they attach is pretty neat. With the slide of a switch the attachments come off.<br /><br />Both the trimmer and the razor work well. The razor has 5 blades for a close smooth shave. I have sensitive skin and had no razor burn with the blade. The trimmer does have a little problem cutting when there is lots of hair to deal with.   298. I received this trimmer for free from Gillette as part of a promotional program they ran. I have purchased several inexpensive trimmers before in the past- One a Phillips Norelco that ran me about $15 and another a mini trimmer by Remington for about $12. So I must preface this review by admitting that I do not have experience with any of the pricier trimmers. However, I have seen this Gillette trimmer on sale in Target for as little as $15, so I am in a good position to compare it pretty fairly with other trimmers in its class.<br /><br />First impression when I took it out of the package was that it was much more substantial than I expected, considering its size. It has a nice rubbery feel and some good heft to it. It feels very comfortable and well balanced in your hands, and it comes with a nice little stand. I was a little disappointed to see that it used a regular AA battery at first (like the little Remington trimmer I have), but as long as you have some rechargeable NiMh AAs around you should be all set. And I suppose this way you don't have to worry about the battery dying out and not being able to replace it.<br /><br />This trimmer has one feature which really sets it out above others in its price range, and that is the fact that you can use it in the shower. Even my Phillips cannot do that. In fact, I have not seen this feature in trimmers under $40 or so before, and it is a welcome addition. At first I couldn't believe that it would really work, and I'm still reluctant to really try putting it under the water flow for fear that it will mess with the blade's lubrication, but I did try shaving my face with it in the shower, and it worked pretty well. I'm not sure that I would want to use it for body hair in the shower, since it's harder to trim hair when it's wet and lying flat.<br /><br />But my absolute favorite thing about this trimmer is its size. The size of the trimmer blade is about halfway between my little Remington and my full size Phillips, andit's just right for trimming just about anywhere. The blade teeth are big enough to cut smoothly but not so large as to be frightening. I found that the size makes it perfect for dry shaving my face. I have taken to using the trimmer (without any of the guards attached) as a replacement for disposable blade wet shaving. It definitely doesn't get as close, but you can avoid cuts, razor burn, and the like, and I actually prefer having a little bit of stubble. And the Gillette will give you a pretty nice, even stubble. I have had absolutely no issues with the blades pulling on facial hair or getting caught up.<br /><br />Now, a couple gripes (although none of them were big enough to cost a full star): I was a little surprised that the trimmer came with three separate guards instead of a single adjustable length one, which is less convenient. However, I'm pretty sure the reason is that having a different mold for each means that no matter what angle you use the trimmer at, you'll still get the right length. So I'll let it slide, although I wish there were more of them. The number 3 is still pretty short, so your hair length options are somewhat limited.<br /><br />Second, the trimmer also comes with a regular wet shaving razor attachment for the ProGlide Razor cartridges (which I also received and will be reviewing shortly). I have always been skeptical of the \\"more blades are better\\" marketing scheme, and the ProGlide razor has given me no reason to change my opinion. I have been using the BiC Metal single blade razors for a couple years now (which are sadly the only disposables on the market of their kind and very hard to find... Gillette would do well to take note and come out with a product to fill this void!) and I find that I can avoid razor burn with them 90% of the time with the single blade--and they don't clog or pull, whereas the 2, 3, 4, and 5(!) blade razors are rough on the skin and leave me with a red face and breakouts the day of (or often the day after) I shave. All that being said, there is no requirement that you use the razor with the trimmer, and it really has nothing to do with the rest of the product- it simply turns the trimmer into a handle.<br /><br />Finally, there is no attachment for nose/ear hair trimming, so you'll have to use something else for that. But the case can be made that this device is designed to do one thing and does it well. The lack of attachments probably has something to do with keeping the product water-tight.<br /><br />So now the only question is whether it will hold up over time (especially using it to shave my face every morning). But so far so good, anyway. The blade is holding up a lot better than the mini Remington I have, and the AA it came with lasted longer than I expected.<br /><br />Recommended.

  309. I received the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer as a promotion program by Gillette. First off, I must say this is an amazing compact shaver/trimmer.   310. I was surprised how well the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer performed.   311. I received the ProGlide Styler free from Gillette. This Gillette Fusion trimmer looks really cool and fits great in the hand too. It has a rubberized feel, and is battery operated, running on 1 AA battery, which is included. Battery operated trimmers can be a bit of a double-edged sword, since you need fresh batteries to give it all the cutting power that it's capable of. This trimmer comes with 3 different guards for beard trimming at different lengths, and a 4 blade shaving attachment as well. The trimmer is sharp and did a good job tidying up my beard. I don't think I'll be using the 4 blade shaver much, but it's an interesting idea to have it as an attachment on a trimmer. Everything's color coordinated, and looks good, and functions well too. It's nice and compact and doesn't take up a lot of room on my bathroom shelf, which is a plus. The base has compartments to hold all the attachments as well. The trimmer is not overly noisy which is also a big plus. I hate trimmers that rattle and buzz really loud. Here's a helpful manscaping tip: put the longest guard on the trimmer, and run it over your eyebrows, so you don't look like an unruly sasquatch! Oh and while we're at it, trim your ear and nose hair too sometimes. There's devices better than this for those purposes, but if you don't have the appropriate ear and nose trimmer, this will make do. I'm always surprised at how many men walk around with disgustingly long ear and nose hair; and I'm not just talking about older men. It's gross, guys, and doesn't make you look cool or tough. Overall, this is a great little trimmer, and would be excellent for travel, given the size.

  319. I gave the Gillette fusion proglide styler power trimmer with Gillette fusion proglide power blade cartridge a try, which was provided to me for free via a program run by Gillette.<br /><br />This is a battery operated unit, which requires 1 AA battery - which was included. There is no AC outlet option.<br /><br />Snapping the cartridges on and off was a cinch. There's a big button on the back of the neck of the handle that makes interchanging really easy. It doesn't accept a backwards facing cartridge, so it's easy to get this right.<br />The power button is directly opposite the accessory release button, and sometimes inadvertently gets triggered.<br /><br />The unit comes with 3 different clipper size guards, 1-2-3, which are comparable, if not the same as common clipper guard metrics. 1 is for a close trim, 2 for a little bit less, and 3 won't even cut unless you've got some hair flowing.<br /><br />The display case easily stores all accessories and is easy to access and exchange said pieces.<br /><br />Now on to the cartridge and shaving.<br /><br />The instruction manual doesn't say much. It mentions that there are 3 blade systems...for those of you looking for the edging blade, you simply use the backside of the proglide power blade cartridge. It's definitely sharp and there isn't much need to use the battery power.<br /><br />Most razors are a solid, non technological, stagnant, rock solid piece. Like some other fancy \\"bro\\" inspired razors, this one's cartridge pivots and attempts to harness the curves and planes of your face's shape. It seemed difficult to cut myself, which is both good/great in terms of safety, but we are talking about a razor here, a dangerous, sharp tool for chiseling facial masterpieces.<br /><br />I agree with some other reviewers that their blades should be replaced with sharper stronger ones. The pivoting action makes you really push down hard to get close shaves, which seems counter intuitive. I want the first pass to cut some hairs, not have me press down so hard that I feel like I'm going to split my skin open, even then, it still doesn't.<br /><br />The trimmer is about half the width size of traditional clippers. Making it seem miniature, however it functions pretty well. Without the guards, it's pretty easy to shave edge lines, once you figure out the motion and direction that the trimmer needs to be facing in order to cut.<br /><br />Overall, the unit was comfortable to hold, pretty cool looking, and it functions like a champ, once you figure it out.
  320. I received my Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer from a program that is run by Gillette. All I can say is WOW! The trimmer is small, but powerful. I did not try it in the shower, but I am sure it will work just as well there. It trimmed my goatee quickly and professionally. I could tell an immediate difference after I used it for the first time.
  321. I received a Fusion ProGlide Styler from Gillette to try out and review. I was honestly expecting no more than an overwrought, overpriced, over-engineered curiosity. It has turned out to meet most of my grooming needs with one bulletproof package, however, and the Amazon cost for this thing is pretty damn reasonable, considering.<br /><br />The package comes with a battery powered trimmer, a multi-blade razor, several guards, and a stand, all of which I use. That the trimmer works, and really well, was my first surprise. It levels off and shapes sideburns effortlessly. It clear-cuts downstairs without pulling or getting caught up. The guards I actually use to keep my scalp hair away from my ears. I just throw one on the trimmer and run it around every week or so. The razor is simply Gillette's proven design that has been around for years. All in all a great package.<br /><br />The only downsides involve the razor heads. Gillette's lubricating strips have always been inferior. They lubricate for a shave or two, and then dry out and start shredding. I am one that, considering how expensive these things are, likes to use these razor heads many times, and the strips just don't hold up. Speaking of expense, the cost of the refills is patently ridiculous. That is why, while I love this product, I probably will not continue to use it unless I can find refills somewhere at a steep discount.<br /><br />I normally use a safety razor AND an electric. This package replaces both for a less money, and takes up much less space. Long term, however, the cost of refills are a black cloud on the horizon. Depending on how you do your thing, and with what, this is probably worth a go, if only for the short term.

It is very easy to maintain and clean as well. I also got the smoothest shave every with the razor attachment. This is the best trimmer/groomer I have owned. You couldn't ask for a better quality product for the price. Gillette really out did themselves on this item!!

  354. Admittedly, I generally don't use electric razors and stylers, but I've always had faith in Gillette putting out quality products, so I thought it was worth a try.<br /><br />The good: first to my surprise, this styler is actually stylish! Not that looks alone should determine whether you buy it, but a lot of stylets are more bulky and clunky, while the Proglide Styler is actually sleek and lightweight. My actual shaving experience was also impressive. The Proglide Styler is easy to maneuver and has almost no drag, even against the grain. It's responsive handling allows even minor, miniscule corrections without making you feel like you need to just shave everything off.<br /><br />In addition, the actual accompanying razor blade worked quite well. Sharp and slick, it similarly allowed a fast, smooth shave.<br /><br />The bad: the trimmer attached to the razor blade was difficult to use properly, and did not feel as responsive. Also, while not particularly loud, the Proglide Styler does have a distinct buzz, and I wake up early and have an infant. While its sound is not a deal- breaker, anyone living I'm a small apartment or with noise-sensitive roommates/family should be aware of this.

The holder allows all of the pieces to be placed in an orderly position. The three piece comb/guide set allows trimming for proper lengths. The battery supplies ample power for all of my needs. The Gillette Styler did as good a job in trimming body hair as my current trimmer that cost 3 times as much. I did not care for the shaving cartridge attachment. Putting the shaving cartridge on top made for a very bulky feel to shaving and I'm just not a fan of the five blade Gillette Fusion cartridge. Cleaning the Styler was easy for the most part. Although the razor opens around the blades for cleaning, I still found it slightly difficult to remove all of the hair from around the blades and internal mechanism. All in all, this is a very good product. I like the styler and will continue to use it. Thanks Gillette.

  425. Due to a recent program run by Gillette I was able to give the new Gillette Proglide Styler Power Trimmer a go. After a week of use I feel I have a good idea of what the proglide power trimmer is and who its for. Let me start out by saying that this is a very smartly constructed unit. The device fits nicely in the palm and makes for one handed operation of the trimmer easy and accurate. The weight of the proglide is minimal enough that you're not burdened, but yet has some heft (which I like) to give it some balance and establish that this is not a cheap poorly built piece of equipment. Another point I appreciate is that the handle is fitted with a rubberized grip surrounding the body that will prevent slips and assure accuracy when trimming. Getting to the heart of the device, the top trimming end, the actual shaver is smaller than your average barbershop clipper in width, and has the ability to connect to different spacers can latch on to a actual razor blade. Within your kit you will find that all of these are supplied from the get go and are a really nice bonus so no need to buy other attachments you got all you need right there.<br />I can see this as a product that is great for a guy who cares about the way he looks, and wants to make sure that he maintains the freshly groomed look throughout the day. Over the week I trimmed my sideburns to a nice straight angle while cleaning up some of the stragglers hairs who tend to grow out of my burns at a faster rate than the others. I also trimmed some facial hair, which it really did a nice job at, and because I was curious even trimmed some hair off a not too noticeable area of my leg. Conclusion it did a great job at that too, so if you are a guy who wants to get rid of chest hair, or anywhere else for that matter, this will work for you.<br />Overall my impression was highly positive and I would highly recommend this trimmer/shaving system. Kudos for making such a high quality product.

  428. I received a Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer from a program run by Gillette I love how it comes with 3 facial hair tools. With the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer, it is easy to keep up any kind of facial hair and it is quick and easy to use.
  429. I have been using this trimmer for a little more than a month, and I must say that I am impressed. Everything from the comfort of the handle to the compact storage for the three hair combs and ProGlide attachment has increased my productivity during my shave.<br /><br />Let me start off with the monkey in the room, so to speak - the awkward-looking attachment for the ProGlide/Fusion razor cartridge that is included. When I first opened the product and snapped the razor attachment on, I was pleasantly surprised with both the ease of use and solid construction, mainly because it appeared at first to be quite a bit larger and more awkward than traditional razor handles. As odd as it seems, I feel like I have more control with the wider/larger handle, which is simply the inactive trimmer portion. I have had significantly less razor irritation when using the ProGlide attachment, and I attribute that to the ability to apply more even pressure with the improved grip. I will admit, using the single blade for precision trimming too a little to get used to because of the significantly larger size of the entire razor, but that is a small price to pay for the added benefit of being able to apply even pressure (and not ending up with a bloody mess on your neck!). The storage solution for this attachment is sufficient for most, but I thoroughly rinse my razor cartridge after shaving, and having the attachment (with cartridge attached) inverted (as seen in the product picture above) seems to trap moisture, which has been shown to dull the blade quicker. As I said above, I have only had it for about a month, but I have noticed the blade getting duller quicker than usual, and the only thing that has changed has been the storage.<br /><br />Before I describe my experience with the trimmer, let me admit that before getting this product, I had (and still love) a Philips Norelco beard trimmer with a multi-length comb attachment included, so I may be being too harsh on what is included in this package for a very reasonable price. Without the combs attached, you can easily edge your beard and take care of unwanted stubble without much resistance or irritation. I have very thick, coarse facial hair and I have rarely found (with many attempts) a trimmer than can take care of my hair without catching or tugging, which causes discomfort and irritation. So, when I tried the trimmer sans attachments on my stubbly neck for the first time, I was very happy with the closeness and comfort. Gillette did a great job with the trimmer portion, and the product quality is evident from initial inspection. That said, after seeing the lack of different lengths for beard-trimming combs, I was slightly disappointed. Included in the package are three comb attachments - small, medium, and large - and for many people they would probably suffice, but when you can find a trimmer for only a few dollars more that includes a wide variety of lengths, you question why Gillette didn't include an adjustable trimmer attachment. Not only would this solution use less plastic, it would also require less storage space and cover all of the bases, virtually eliminating all competition in this space. For those not too picky about their beard length, the included lengths will likely suit your needs. But because I am, I knocked the product review down a star.<br /><br />I'll quickly discuss the battery life and storage solution with one word - efficient. The battery life has been SUPERB for me. I usually dislike battery-operated trimmers because of the short runtimes, but I have yet to change batteries or notice a degradation in performance, and I have used it every almost every other day. Other trimmers in this class would show a dip in blade speed or sound like a broken-down car at this point - believe me, I've tried a lot of them. As for the storage, the package allows for you to easily keep your trimmer, combs, and ProGlide razor cartridge in a convenient space that takes up no more room on the shelf than a mug. Also important to point out is that it looks very chic and stylish, so if you keep this grooming package within sight of guests you will not be embarrassed in the least.<br /><br />So in closing, I would recommend this product for sure. Even if you are picky about your beard length, this is still a great product for the bare trimmer and the more secure ProGlide attachment that, in my opinion, gives you a better shave. I received this product as part of a program being run by Gillette, so I cannot speak about how much I paid, but I surely would have paid the retail asking price. The surprisingly improved ProGlide shave will keep this as my daily driver in that regard, but the trimmer part will likely be reserved for touch-ups and travel trimming.<br /><br />And no, I do not \\"manscape\\" - so I can't speak to the positives/negatives in that practice.

It's also pretty good for trimming other body hair...I'll spare you the details. My only complaint is that the batteries don't last long at all and mine seems to be on the fritz after 3 weeks of use.
  433. I don't use a razor very often; in fact, I don't even keep one around the sink anymore. But I do tighten up what facial fuzz I can grow every morning. That said, for how I use it, I have only small issues with the Gillette Fusion Proglide Styler.<br /><br />When I was offered a promotion for a free Gillette Fusion Proglide Styler, I didn't want to pass on the chance to try out an updated trimmer that is comparable to a Remington trimmer I have been using for a number of years ... which brings me to the what I like most about the Styler. Having used a comparable Remington unit now for a long while that is rechargeable -- and having used a Remington model prior to it, until it would no longer hold a charge -- it seemed a good idea to get into a new model before the battery failed and left me half trimmed. Again.<br /><br />No worries here. While rechargeable devices may be considered more green, the Styler makes more sense by operating on a single AA battery that can be easily purchased on the road or at a hotel ... or borrowed from another device even. It being a common, readily available power source is very handy when you would forget your power cord at home -- but you swear you charged it before you left. Consider how great that unique battery in your DSLR is when you run out of juice. Wouldn't it be nice to drop in a few AA batteries and be back in the game?<br /><br />The Styler is priced right, and the option to have a replaceable cartridge blade is a nice touch. The last razor I did have used the same cartridges, so I have some extras ... in fact, the last actual razor I had was the Gillette that vibrated, so I the exact same cartridges and I still have a good battery somewhere, too. I never did understand vibrating feature; is it supposed to saw through my scruff before the 5+ blades can slice through it?<br /><br />Just a note: You can still power on this unit while the blade is attached, bringing back those old vibrations on this (useless?) feature -- intended or not.<br /><br />The Styler does come packed with three height attachments. I am one who grows very little facial hair but depends on an adjustable-head trimmer to even out my patchy \\"beard.\\" The Styler did the job here, but compared to my former Remington the blade width is much narrower. While the narrow trim path doesn't bother me on my face, it is noticeable. Someone with more surface area on the face ... well, it could get taxing. Compare to mowing your lawn with an 16\\" cut mower to a 22\\"; the difference seems minimal but it takes more time.<br /><br />Where this does effect me is when I'm on the road, where I could tighten up my crew cut in a pinch with the Remington. The main cutting blade -- at just over 1\\" wide -- made short work of an overgrown fade, and had a similar cut to my regular clippers at home, resulting in some pretty clean work.<br /><br />So I'm a little disappointed in the size of the cutting head here on the Styler. It is marketed as a full-body groomer after all.<br /><br />When I opened the Styler, it's a sleek little device! The packaging is thoughtful, and everything tucks away into different parts of the Styler's stand. And that's great for on a counter top where it looks really sharp. But it's all a little loose for traveling. I don't know what I'm asking for here, honestly, so maybe I shouldn't complain, but with the Remington, one of the attachments was a foil razor if I needed a close \\"shave.\\" It's not a like a 5-blade razor was loose in my travel bag; would you believe there is no cover included for the cartridge head of the Styler, or would that have been so hard to include?<br /><br />That little lack of [safe] portability is really the only other problem I have with it. But for as little as I use the bladed razor, I'll leave it at home and hope that, when in need, a hotel still comps a disposable.<br /><br />To wrap up here, it's watertight with a good grip, nice feel and balance in my hand. It has a replaceable battery, easy to change attachments and VERY easy to clean. I can't knock the Gillette Fusion Proglide Styler for some of my very picky personal preferences, because overall it's a well-designed device. For about $4 more than I what I paid for my Remington, you can tell by the looks and touch that it's a much more solid piece of equipment.<br /><br />Definitely worth the small investment, because this is much more than an entry level body grooming tool.

  461. I bought this mostly for trimming body hair. Though I am not usually looking for shaving level removal, I still look for a very close crop. I would rate this good, but not perfect for my needs.<br /><br />The looks, form and design is really good. You get a good grip at all times and there is never any risk of dropping this accidentally. The batteries (2 AAAs) also last reasonably well. If you are a frequent user, I would recommend investment in rechargeable ones. I think lack of built-in rechargeable batteries is a big drawback. However, I was aware of this when I made the purchase.<br /><br />The performance is also very good. Not very noisy, and it handles longer growths very well and I never had the feeling that it is about to get clogged. I do clean it frequently during the operation as well. The shave was not as close as I like to have. Also, with short hairs, sometimes it just misses, even with multiple passes. I think this is an area where there is definitely scope for some improvement. Lack of a close shave means that setting the 'edge' of my mustache and beard still needs a razor. This won't do. For other body hair, this is fine. However, I acknowledge that this was never advertised as a razor, so I am not really disappointed in this regard. I haven't used the provided shaving blade yet.<br /><br />Three trim length controlling attachments are included and work perfectly fine.<br /><br />So, if you are looking for an electric shaver like performance, look elsewhere. Otherwise this should handle your trimming and close cropping needs perfectly.

This thing is a lot more convenient than my Oster, because there's no heavy cord. It's a lot less of a production to use the Gillette.<br /><br />About 1/3 of the weight is the battery. The trimmer isn't rechargeable, but I'm planning to use rechargeable alkaline batteries after the Duracell it came with dies. So far the battery has lasted 2 hours without dropping power.<br /><br />I bought this at Target because of the coupon. The retail packaging is difficult to take apart without damaging the components. I recommend buying it at Amazon to get the more intelligent bos packaging they offer.

I was hoping it would be something, I could throw in a shaving kit so when work send me on an overnight,I wouldn't have to drag,shaving gel,after shave,razor,and then my beard trimmer,trimmer charger,the right Guide for the trimmer....Great Convenient,no crap I wish I had my trimmer moments.Love it only took a single AA battery,I don't have to worry about running out of power,and needing a special plug to charge my trimmer...All in one...I love the idea...<br /><br />Shaving - For the past 20 years of shaving,I've shaved with a handle that is slightly larger than a pencil,maybe a nice beefy pen.The I shaved with the 3 in 1 styler which has the handle of a round hairbrush.I thought it felt wieldy,like I wasn't as precise,it took my longer,because I had this bigger/longer handle.I kept getting in my way while trying to shave normally.It didn't feel like shaving, it felt a little like hand to hand combat with a hair brush.Being a Gillette fusion blade,that I've used previously,the shave was normal,just more difficult.So while it does work as a shaver,I don't want to go back to being 16 and relearn how to shave.So for me it doesn't work well as a better shaving experience...Even worse for a travel kit,that I might not use every time I shave...<br /><br />Trimmer - Bad,what am I supposed to trim with this?My arm hair?   519. இ Fuzzy Wuzzy's Summary:<br />ѾѾѾѾѾ Highly recommended with warm fuzzies!<br /><br />This little AA-battery-powered trimmer/styler and razor attachment is great for home use and travel. It comes with a useful plastic stand that keeps the trimmer, razor attachment, and three comb attachments all neatly stored on your bathroom counter. And for travel, it all fits easily into a small toiletries bag. The included 5-blade razor is quick and sharp by itself, but when you couple it with the vibrating powered trimmer handle, you actually do get an even closer shave, even though it took me a few shaves to get used to the feeling. The back of the 5-blade razor has a \\"precision edging blade\\" that lets you precisely shape and edge your sideburns. Sometimes, depending upon how much I have let my sideburns grow out, I find it easier to just use the powered trimmer without either the razor or comb attachments and using the trimmer by itself does a great job of shaping my sideburns with crisp clean lines.   522. I bought the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler after seeing it was supposed to be a great tool for facial hair detailing and lining. And after owning it for a month or two now, it's definately a good trimmer to be battery powered, but not great as it is advertised. First I'll list the pros...<br /><br />Pros<br />Great for shaving-With the fusion proglide heads, this razor is awesome. It has the same quality, but better since it has the higher quality handle. I threw away my old proglide handle in favor of this sleeker and more efficent design. As far as the face shaving aspect of this product, it's excellent.<br /><br />Great for trimming your facial hair-Another aspect where the Styler is excellent. I've used it to trim my goatee and sideburns quite a few times, and it gives an even and effective trim. Plus, it's the original reason I bought the Styler, since my Phillips Norelco beard trimmer cut and trimmed my facial hair unevenly. With this though, trimming is very fast and simple. I also like how the trimmer comes with three length combs, making it easy when I decide to grow a beard and blend my goatee with interchangable trimmer combs. When trimming my goatee, I used the 3 guide comb, which is perfect for trimming the length on shaggy hair without completely oblitterating my goatee. Then, when I wanna grow my beard out, I used the 1 guide comb to blend my goatee in with my stubble.<br /><br />The razor comes complete with a stand to hold everything-I couldn't believe for $20, I got a razor/trimmer/attachment combs/tray. The tray that comes inside the packaging means your bathroom will be more organized than using traditional razors or trimmers. It's also smart the way the tray has 3 openings in the back for each guide comb and one opening in the top for the fusion head attachment to rest in. And the fusion attachment head is built efficently, since it has an attachment that fits neatly on top of the trimmer head. It also looks cooler and makes storage easy and effective.<br /><br />Now onto the cons...<br /><br />Cons<br />Not great for lining facial hair-While this trimmer is perfect for trimming facial hair and shaving, it's not great at lining a beard, sideburns or goatee. This actually surprized me, since the Gillette campaign in the advertisements claims it's great for lining and detailing. Specifically showing in the commercials how supposedly great it is in detailing and lining facial hair. In that department, it's a bit of a disappointment, but I've never found any cartridge razor that can line as well as a disposable razor, and this is no exception. And as far as the edger is concerned, the few times I've tried lining with it, it never did a phenominal job, more like mediocre at best, since in most instances I wound up using a disposable razor to correct it.<br /><br />Doesn't have a long battery life-Not really too surprizing here, since I'm kind of OCD when it comes to keeping my facial hair looking neat. Plus, I have used it more often than just on my face, thus a partial reason why the battery isn't lasting very long. I'd say the average battery life of the Styler would be a month if not used for body hair or any other non facial detailing purpose. Since it's so efficent though, this isn't a major issue for me. Others might see it that way however, since batteries are kind of costly to replace.<br /><br />Not great for use on body hair or lining the back of your neck-I really don't consider these two areas major issues, since the Styler is only intended for face use anyway. I feel though that I must point out for those who think this might be great for trimming body hair or good for lining your neck in between barber visits, this isn't the tool for either purpose. With this being a battery controlled trimmer, it'd take you forever to use on body hair. Plus, to me using something on your body hair that's intended for your face is kind of cross contaminating anyway. I initially thoughtI might be able to use this for lining my neck hair in between trims, but this won't leave an even cut or line. Something my old beard trimmer could do, but again not a big deal to me, since this product is for facial shaving and maintenance.<br /><br />Overall, I rate this 4 out of 5 stars since it's great at shaving and trimming facial hair. Really, for about $20 bucks, this Styler is a quality invcstment for any guy. It can do most things a beard trimmer can at half the cost(not counting the cheapo pieces of crap trimmers). I wish this thing was rechargable, then it would be darn near perfect. If you're expecting to be using this for any other purpose than facial hair, you might want to invest in a good body hair trimmer or hair clipper set instead. Otherwise though, I have been happy with this purchase and would buy another set once it needed replacing.I might be able to use this for lining my neck hair in between trims, but this won't leave an even cut or line. Something my old beard trimmer could do, but again not a big deal to me, since this product is for facial shaving and maintenance.<br /><br />Overall, I rate this 4 out of 5 stars since it's great at shaving and trimming facial hair. Really, for about $20 bucks, this Styler is a quality invcstment for any guy. It can do most things a beard trimmer can at half the cost(not counting the cheapo pieces of crap trimmers). I wish this thing was rechargable, then it would be darn near perfect. If you're expecting to be using this for any other purpose than facial hair, you might want to invest in a good body hair trimmer or hair clipper set instead. Otherwise though, I have been happy with this purchase and would buy another set once it needed replacing.

  525. I'm giving this product a 1 star rating because Amazon doesn't have anything lower. It took one try to conclude it was totally useless for my purposes. I have a full beard that is cropped fairly close to the chin line. I found the Fusion Pro Glide razor head too thick and bulky to perform any type of precision shaving at the edge lines. Coupled with the trimmer as a handle, it was extremely awkward to use. I attempted to use the battery operated trimmer along the lip line underneath my moustache and got nothing. The trimmer is not sharp enough and does not get close enough to cut anything. Trying to trim the rest of my beard with the snap on combs was an exercise in futility. The trimmer head is too small and the 3 combs do not provide enough flexibility in terms of hair length. All in all, I found this product to be a total waste of money. The best part was the Duracell battery which I removed before throwing the rest in the trash. Do yourself a favor and don't get taken in by s slick marketing campaign designed to sell overpriced razor heads. If Gillette had spent as much money on the product as they did on the packaging it might be a different story. There are a number of small rechargeable beard/moustache trimmers in the same price range that out perform this product and a variety of disposable razors that offer more precise shaving. I'd rather have a couple of products that perform well instead of one that does not.

  545. When I saw the commercial for this on TV, I was a bit skeptical. I thought to myself hmmm it's probably just another product by gillette. I like to keep my face trimmed so I was like why not, let me give this a try. It's cheap and if worst comes to worst I won't be losing a lot. So, this arrived within 2 days of my order (thanks to amazon's prime membership). Now, first thing that caught my eye right off the bat was how well built the little razor actually looked. The design is very nice and the grip itself feels great holding in hand. But enough about the looks, let's get on with the features of the razor. First of all the razor is a trimmer that comes with 3 seperate clips depending on how long you want to trim your beard. 2nd it comes with only one pair of razor but don't worry the set comes with a little holding stand where you can put everything together and put it aside in your bathroom. The stand makes the razor look very nice and professional.<br /><br />So, now the most important part is to answer the question how well does it perform? Well, let's just say I feel like I don't need to buy another razor ever again. This razor turned on with vibration, gave me one of the most closest shave I have ever gotten. I have very sensitive skin but this razor just glides through and leaves me no marks and leaves my skin feeling great. But that's not it, the best part about this little device has to be the trimmer. This trimmer can buzz through any thick hair and I mean any. I use this as my body groomer now. What used to take me 30 mins in the shower now takes about 2 minutes. This thing is worth way more than it's price and I am glad I decided to try it. I hope anyone looking for a trimmer and razor decides to go with this purchase you won't be dissapointed. This is like a body groomer also, so you cannot lose.

  549. I had originally given this five stars, and after having two of them bust within six months of purchase I'm deeply suspicious that these are designed to break. Neither one made it past a second battery. Not sure? Scroll to the top of the screen. Notice the &#34;Subscribe and Save&#34; button? Why would anyone need to have a new one delivered on a regular basis? Now look at all of the competing groomers and you'll see that none of them have a subscription button, because they aren't intended to be disposable like this is. There are far more reliable groomers for the price, some of which come with rechargeable batteries and chargers. Save your money and avoid this one.

  554. Normally I would never write a review after 1 use, however this Gillette Fusion Proglide 3 in 1 Styler Special Pack warranted one. When I was checking it out, saw a review that mentioned how good it felt in your hand, untill I held it in my hand to shave, I had no idea how huge that point was. Never have I had a manual razor feel this solid and in control while shaving. Lets face it, this is a man's razor, and we want our tools to be substantial, well-built, and, well, manly, & this tool fits the bill. If you purchased this for the handle alone, I think you'd be happy. (although I did get mine on 1 of their deals for 14 bucks, & I already have a Fusion Proglide, so have blades for it) But it does come with more, trimmer & styling combs. Since I've been shaving in the shower for years, I always had to trim the length later with a cordless electric trimmer. In just 1 time being able to trim lenght with the styler comb in the shower, well, I am singing in the shower (sorry couldn't resist). With its powered action, the styler trimmer did a beautiful , and quick job of trimming to length. Only negative I found, its very hard to release the blade, or comb without hitting the button to turn it on. Bottom line, even after 1 shave, its the best razor I've ever used. One last note, if your not shaving in the shower, get a fogless mirror & try it with whatever razor you use. You won't believe how much the extra moisture helps, and I swear the blades last longer too.

  584. Let's get one thing out of the way up front: if you think you're going to spend about $20 on this and have the clippers of a barber shop, go buy something else.<br /><br />If you've let your face and hair go for awhile and you want to use this to start over (slash through thick sideburns, remove the handlebars on your moustache, chop off the Santa-beard), it's going to be an uphill battle.<br /><br />On the other hand, if you're looking for something to edge a moustache, keep sideburns in their place on a regular basis, and make sure you have two eyebrows instead of one, this is great for you. I use the trimmer to get the hair of my moustache that tries to curl onto my upper lip, i put on the clipper attachment #3 to keep the overall moustache down, and the razor attachment for everyday shaving.<br /><br />This is the first kit that has let me use a manual razor without keeping the electric one around for trimming. It's easy cleaning, just pop the top open and spray with water. It doesn't look cheap so it's not too shabby sitting there on the bathroom counter, and the little storage stand/caddy isn't a crappy gimmick. In fact, the section for the razor attachment even has a small hole cut out so you can put the razor away without messing up the lubrication stripe.<br /><br />I thought the size of this would make it awkward to hold and use, but i actually feel i have a better grip on it than the pencil-thin razor handles you usually get. I'll put a more in-depth review of the razor in the cartridges product listing, but in short i can't complain. The single \\"precision\\" blade on the back of the cartridge is not the face-shredder i thought it would be and lets me get in closer than the Schick precision-mode on their Hydro 5. The 5 blades on the front clog easy with hair and at first were hard to clean until i thought to blast hot water from the back. The precision blade can be a bit rough to clean though.<br /><br />I'm giving this 5 stars because the only thing that would disappoint me is if the expensive blades don't last long, but that will be reflected in their own review. This product fits its niche well and if you get it knowing that instead of thinking you've found a way to \\"beat the system\\" with an inexpensive product, you'll be just as happy as i am.

  603. I love this razor/trimmer, especially for less than $20! I've been using it for almost a year now with no complaints.<br /><br />It comes with a base to hold everything, the &#34;core&#34; of the razor, three clip-on heads for trimming, and another head that is actually a razor and not a trimmer.<br /><br />I really like that this accomplishes both my trimming and shaving needs in one little kit - it's also small enough that it's easy to bring the entire thing if I travel.<br /><br />As for how effective it is - it works great as both a razor and trimmer. The razor part uses the Fusion Proglide blade heads - luckily, I happened to already use a Fusion Proglide before I bought this, so I am able to use the same heads I already had on this. I notice no difference in quality whatsoever between this combo pack and the stand-alone Fusion Proglide, which I have been using for years.<br /><br />The trimmer part is also great, and is why I picked this combo-razor up in the first place. You can use it without any of the plastic attachments and it will trim down to bare skin (though obviously not as well as a razor), or one of the three plastic combs, which trim at length #s 1, 2, or 3. The plastic combs are sturdy and easy to attach/remove, and VERY easy to clean.<br /><br />The whole thing is waterproof, so you can bring it with you into the shower and avoid getting hair everywhere when you trim parts of your body. I have never had any snags/cuts or anything like that from using the trimmer, so it's safe to use everywhere.<br /><br />This was a great purchase. It's well-made and has held up to daily use for almost a year with no noticeable wear and tear.

But the damned thing will open up and pinch my face, about five times, every shave. To use it, I have to pinch down on the head so hard, that my index finger gets fatigued. This thing is garbage! Oh, and the battery does not last long, but I guess that's to be expected with AA.<br /><br />If you're using this to trim a beard with some height (eg. using one of the attached spacers), it does a reasonable job. I regret the $20 I spent on it, and with Gillette put a fraction of their Marketing budget into R&D. Or maybe some of their execs should actually try using the B.S. products.

My 20 year old Con-air trimmer does better due to more power (2 AA batteries as opposed to 1 AA battery for the styler). And the replacement cartridges prices are insane, although you can get the 6 cartridge replacement from Amazon for cheaper than you can a 4 cartridge replacement at any store. I suggest buying the fusion proglide razor instead of the 3-in-1 trimmer. Not worth the money for the trimmer

  738. I've been a huge Gillete fan for years, but always found myself skeptical of the beard trimmers due to the thickness of my beard. I spent years researching electric razor/bead trimmer combos that were in the hundreds of dollars, and all the while I kept seeing the commercial for the Fusion Proglide Styler. I randomly jumped on amazon and was amazed by the reviews! I gave it a shot and have been even more amazed as to how awesome this thing is!<br /><br />PROS: This thing may be small, but it cuts through even my thick hair. The 3 adjustable guides allow for trimming from a stubble beard, up to about .25 inch thick. I was even more impressed with how much I like using the actual pro glide razor with the built in trimmer. Now I get the closest shave where I don't want my beard, my beard is all the same perfect length of my choosing, AND the precision trimmer allows me to get the pesky hairs that grow over my lip and fine tune the edges of my beard. I feel like I'm getting a professional trim and shave with this thing!<br /><br />CONS: the only thing I don't like about it is that with the single AA battery it runs out of juice quickly if your beard is really thick. I decided to use rechargeable AAs so that it would keep the cost down and it's been great.

Personally I get a closer more comfortable shave with cheap old BIC Single Sensitive Shavers 12 pk and a helluva lot cheaper.   790. I've been using Wahl 9918-6171 Groomsman Beard and Mustache Trimmer for years but you can't let it get wet. It isn't really designed for body grooming but it did a good job on my beard for years with no trouble at all.<br /><br />Recently, I had to trim the Johnson and family jewels as well as my stomach and upper thighs due to a surgical procedure. I did not want the hospital orderly doing the shaving for me. I've been there and done that and lived to regret it.<br /><br />I don't normally buy Gillette because nearly all of their products are made outside the USA and they are expensive as all get out. A while back I bought a Fusion ProGlide razor just to check it out and it gave a really good shave for me and my ultra sensitive face. I have a couple of Braun electric toothbrushes that the family likes and they have been totally reliable (yes, they are imports but there are no domestic alternatives). Anyway, this was a Braun co-branded product so I took the plunge.<br /><br />It works great in the shower and has a rubbery grip so you don't drop it all the time. Did not have any problems with hair sticking to it as others have mentioned. When used as a plain razor, you can turn it on and get a little vibration in the blade while shaving. I can't tell a difference on or off. Trimmer blades are sharp and didn't pull. Be sure to use a drop of oil now and then.<br /><br />The Styler performs very well. Comb lengths give a good variety and the bare trimmer is pretty delicate. The Mrs. has been eyeing it since she saw me use it in the shower. She goes bare down there and this immediately appealed to her. All in all, it does all that is claimed as far as I am concerned. I'm an electric razor guy so I do a lot a trimming anyway. This Styler gives me a lot more flexibility and a closer, neater trim than my old Wahl. It is on the smallish side; my big hands kinda swallow it up so be advised. Normal folks should be OK. Us knuckle-draggers are going extinct-we can't dial cell phones either.<br /><br />The holder for everything is pretty stable but could use some rubber feet to keep it from slipping about. Four dabs of silicone will fix that. Has a small footprint and it will fit in my medicine cabinet if turned sideways. A really good option would be to modify the holder design so that you could slap on a 3M Command Adhesive Strip and stick it up on the shower wall. Water drains easily so there's no mess.<br /><br />Honestly, I think this was designed with the MetroSexuals in mind, but that's OK. It works for me and I'm hairier than the average bear, as Yogi used to say. You'll probably like it and maybe your significant other will too.

  820. I almost rated this poorly. I initially tried to edge dry. I laughed as the trimmer failed to edge anything. Give it a shot wet and with shaving cream/gel on. I was VERY impressed. I had been using a Mach 3 and a double edged razor blade (for detail). After my first use, I really like the results. Not perfect, but better than any combination of items I've used recently.   822. I've tried many failed experiments with more expensive trimmers, but this one enabled me, for the first time, grow a well-groomed beard.
