  823. I bought this because I travel light and like to keep my beard trimmed, and my regular electric razor with its charging unit was taking up too much space in my bag.<br /><br />It's more compact than it looks in the product photo: the Fusion cartridge (which you use for shaving) is a separate attachment which can sit alongside the main unit, making it easier to fit everything into a small toiletries bag. However, it's heavier than I expected. Not heavy enough to be objectionable; it just has a bit more heft than you'd think if you saw it sitting on the bathroom counter.<br /><br />The fact that it uses an AA battery rather than a factory-sealed rechargeable battery means I don't need to carry around extra gear to keep it juiced. I've had it for over a month now and am still on my initial battery. Part of that may be due to another thing I like about this unit, the fact that you can use the shaver without turning on the motor. I usually shave most of my face without turning on the motor, then remove the shaver head and power up the trimmer to clean up my beard.<br /><br />So far I'm having better luck with the cartridges than many of the other people writing reviews. It took about 3 weeks of daily use before I started to notice the blades getting dull enough to affect the quality of the shave, and another week before I felt like it was time to switch to a new cartridge. I don't think this is due to any special care I'm taking to maintain the blades; it's probably more due to the texture of my skin and facial hair. I rarely use shaving cream since my skin isn't sensitive, so maybe that's part of it. In any event, this means I can get by for months on an 8-pack of Fusion cartridges, long enough to make their price a non-issue.<br /><br />The biggest annoyance is cleanup, which is why I'm giving this 4 stars instead of 5. The trimmer blade compartment pops open so you can rinse out any accumulated hairs, but inevitably there are a couple stray ones remaining. Sometimes blowing into the compartment gets rid of them but sometimes you need to use a fingernail to pull them out. If you don't mind little bits of hair sticking in your trimmer this won't be an issue for you.
  824. This razor works great. The only downside is the blades cost about $4 each. Buy the 8 pack of blades when you get it to save a little.
  825. I always love gillette Fusion or Mach3 for shave but one thing I used to miss was playing with my side logs (hairs on the side face behind cheeks) Now I can make precision cut. Also I am making new style with beard in minutes.<br />Amazon gave me such a nice rate for this product that I am really thankful<br />VERY NICE PRODUCT, definitly 10 on 10 with such price
  826. I love how this works. The trimming guards are really easy to put on. It all stores in a small place and it has the option to be a razor. For the price this is a great piece of equipment. Very versatile and it is great quality. Very recommended

  838. This is much, much better than a former Phillips shaver I had (one of those with 3 disks.. I can't figure why people like it) and a grey Panasonic for the whole body. The Panasonic sometimes caught my skin and made bruises, even if I used it with the comb attached to 2mm. This cheap little thing here does none of it and is even much easier to use due to its small size.<br /><br />Aye: cheap, easy, small (so it's easy to contour your face/body), portable, Braun (german) manufacturing, everything you need for a simple trim/shave<br /><br />Nay: 1 - you've got to be careful with the plastic combs, if you force them when taking off or putting on you'll surely break it. But it fits nicely, so if you must use force then you're probably doing something wrong. 2- Since the blades of the trimmer are small, it can take a little longer than a bigger trimmer to trim a big area, but at most 1 minute longer. 3 - It's hard to clean the blades compartment afterwards, since it doesn't fully open, just partially, so some hair will live there forever, but it's actually not a big deal. 4 - Well, that's a hit and a miss, but it uses AA batteries instead of a rechargeable battery; you can use rechargeable AA batteries but I think it's better to have a &#34;native&#34; battery so you don't have to worry about AA batteries. 5- The gillete razors are expensive, that's where the company makes the big money (there's no way to have a clean/perfect shave with just the trimmer - you'll need the razor for that, although the trimmer makes the hair small enough if you don't need a clean shave for your job).<br /><br />But still, with all those &#34;nays&#34;, I'm very glad I bought it (heck I gave it 5 stars), since it works perfectly well for my needs and is the cheapest trimmer I could find
  839. I use it as my daily facial shaver as its quick and it works great. It is waterproof so you can even use it in the shower.

And this little Styler is not wimpy, it has a fast long lasting power and is good on the battery life too. It is just too bad the blade is not replaceable, I can only think what a waste of resources, from mining the product from the Earth, and every step to get the resources ready to manufacture it, including packaging materials and efforts, to distribution, to delivery, to the store putting it up on the shelf, to the consumer working to make the money to buy it and the gas to go to the store, only to use it till it gets dull and have to throw it out. What a loss. Our throw away world is truly immature and is using up the Planet's resources long before we will be gone. I shave my friends with a straight blade so I can't comment on the shaver part of the package, but I can say I will keep buying it as it does what I want... except have replaceable blades... I'd by 100 of them if it did.

  882. The feel of holding and shaving with this handle is far superior to the pencil thin handles I had been using in the past - the soft rubber ridges make for a strong grip for smooth strokes.<br />2. The \\"power\\" vibrations seem to help in getting a closer shave plus feel like gentle massaging of the cheeks feels awesome.<br />3. This comes with 3 plastic \\"combs\\" which fit over the electric trimmer built into the handle - the trimmer can be used with or without these combs - very handy in keeping the bushy eyebrows trimmed (or beard / mustache trimmed) - they can also be used for \\"fading\\" body hair, though thats going to take a long time with the narrow trimmer :)<br />4. The on/off button can be half pressed for activating the vibration/trimmer function for the duration the button is kept pressed or a harder push of the button clicks it into continuous on or off state.<br />5. There is a holder provided to keep the razor and the combs - which helps keep the handle and blade in a vertical position and looks good.<br />6. The proglide blade itself is very good with 5 blades on the front and one on the back. The front blades give a good general shave and the back blade is handy to reach those hard to shave places like the spot just under the nose on the upper lip.<br />7. The power function works on one AA battery, which is easy to replace, no matter which part of the world you are in.<br />8. As per the instructions, this razor can be used in the shower, hence its water sealed.<br /><br />The only \\"con\\" that i have come up with so far is that the blades are expensive. It remains to be seen how long the blades last.<br /><br />I was so impressed with this system that i promptly bought a second one to keep in my travel bag !r, hence its water sealed.<br /><br />The only \\"con\\" that i have come up with so far is that the blades are expensive. I didn't want a full blown high end 'beard trimmer' either as I -do- shave 90% of my face still. These factors, plus the cost, led me right back to the tried and true 3-in-1 trimmer. It's fairly cheap, I can easily snap one of the three guards on and trim away now, keeping my facial hair much neater than trying to freestyle trim It with my 790 and it doesn't take up much space on the counter top. I like that it uses batteries too, since I hate unplugging the 790 or the other accessories that are always left plugged. So overall, if you're like me someone who just has a little facial hair and needs a quick trimmer this thing is golden. Its not going to last you forever, but you'll get your monies worth.   930. Pros - With the primary shaving attachment, this works as well as any other vibrating, battery-powered razor, which is to say it works very well. A nice, clean shave. Battery power is decent, had to change mine after a few months, but that's only a little less than comparable razors. Really sleek design, very convenient to just leave by a sink or in the shower. Contains all its own parts, very handy. Good comfortable grip and feel. Solid design.<br /><br />Cons - The attachments for trimming and clipping beards and mustaches don't work on my unit. As soon as they are attached, the unit simply ceases to work. You can feel the vibration slow way down as soon as a guard is attached, and then just stop. Once I take the guard off and replace it with the primary razor for shaving, it works just great again. This is clearly a design flaw of some sort, and turns what could have been a really handy grooming gadget into just another razor.<br /><br />I'm giving the device two stars because the pros simply can't overcome the massive con of the guards not working with the razor, which is the reason it is double (or more) the price of a 'normal' razor, and the reason I bought it.
  931. Great groomer! Compact. Easy to clean. I'm not quite sure what the buzzing feature does, and I cannot tell if it improves my shaving experience while it's buzzing. But I like this a lot.
  932. There is no catching of hair.<br /><br />I like the attachments. Especially the proglide razor function.   985. I bought this trimmer on sale about two years ago & am well pleased with it. Here are some things you should know which aren't clear from the directions: If the trimmer becomes clogged it will slow down.The head will flip open for cleaning if you remove any accessories & push back on the trimmer head.You can even rinse it under the tap (leave open to dry).I saw some YouTube reviews about this but strangely they kept mentioning this feature but didn't actually show how to do it.I had to play around with the head a bit to see how it worked.Easy once you do it. The snap on blue trim head depth guides look brittle.In order to preserve them,I recommend you use the little slide catch for both installing & removing the guides rather than just pressing them in place. I found that you can accomplish very nice trims with great precision with this trimmer & it also travels well.You can get a uniform beard length if you go over a given area from several directions. The trimmer's speed increases significantly,if you wet it under the faucet. I get pretty good mileage from premium lithium batteries. I have a large-sized rechargeable trimmer as well,but I usually prefer to use this one. I rarely use the razor attachment but it's nice to have it as a backup. I hope these tips help. Recomended

The other trimmers have either broken quickly, don't trim at all, or the different trim length heads aren't reliable. If you've used Gillette razors before and need a new one, this is a good buy.   1060. I'm a big fan of the Gillette Fusion ProGlide and have a subscribe and save subscription to order replacement blades. I keep a clean shave on my neck and cheeks while keeping a trimmed beard. I thought this would really allow me to have one device which would allow me to solve all my shaving needs. Although technically it does, it doesn't do this without a very awkward approach. Unlike some devices which are dual ended to allow a quick flip to switch ends, the Gillette Fusion ProFlide 3 In 1 Styler requires that you attach add-ins to the end. This means that you have your razor attached to a razor holder which is attached to the main styler unit. It feel very long at this point and not very secure, as it somewhat wobbles with use. Once you want to do trimming, you need to remove the razor and find a place to store it (it doesn't really fit in the holder). If you don't want the closest trim, you then need to take the one of two guards and attach this to the styler. Again, it technically works, but is such a burden that I've given up and just use my regular ProGlide razor and this to keep my sideburns aligned.

I've always felt the 5-blades were overkill anyways, and just a reason for the razor companies to be able to charge their customer more. Well, in the case of this trimmer, seeing how the trimmer is designed for custom and cool beard and mustache styles, as they advertise on their commercial, a much smaller 2-blade razor works much better for tight places around the nose and lips that you need smooth clean edges on. I use a 2-blade for that.<br />So hey, Gilette, lose the 5-blade, for a 2-blade attachment, and it will be a perfect trimming system.

  1072. I loved my Fusion ProGlide and after 30 days it broke.   1073. This thing is really really fantastic! It just works. The only thing that might require a bit of a learning curve is \\"opening\\" the teeth to rinse it out. The instructions say you're supposed to do this after each use. You may feel like you're breaking it, but just push up against the teeth, and it will open, kind of like a snake's mouth. Rinse it out and dry, and snap it back the next time you use it! Really perfect size for travel and carrying around. I really like it a lot.
  1074. There's nothing wrong with the way it shaves. The problem is how long it lasts. I was very disappointed when my trimmer stopped working on first use. If it wasnt for the length it lasted it would be a great product. There was no fix to the problem I was having with the trimmer so unfortunately it was a waste of money.

The best part was I could use it in the shower and avoid all that messy sink cleanup.<br /><br />Three months passed and this thing absolutely died on me. Regardless of whether I have a brand new battery in it, this shaver does not perform anymore. I assume the motor burned out. I guess I wasn't all that surprised.   1102. My old rechargeable trimmer broke, so I started looking for a new one. I was primarily interested in certain features (trimming beard & mustache, sideburns and nose hair). I preferred a built-in rechargeable version so that I could avoid buying batteries over the years of use. I know that I can use rechargeable batteries in this unit, but I wanted the recharging feature built in like my last few trimmers and avoid manual recharging. I was intrigued with this model based on the manufacturer, design and good rating, but it had a few drawbacks which made me delay my purchase. This product does not come with a nose trimmer and it does not have a built-in recharger. However, when I could not find any other trimmer that I liked, I kept returning to this one. So, finally I bought it. It was a good decision. The battery seems to be lasting a long time. I still don't like the fact that it has no nose trimming adapter, but going back to manual nose-hair trimming has not killed me yet. I tried the vibrating razor attachment once just for fun and it seems to work well. But I still prefer my electric razor and I wonder how much the replacement blades will cost when the included blades are dull and need to be replaced. Overall, Iike the quality of the trimmer and the job it does trimming my beard, mustache and sideburns; it seems to be a decent shaver as well. I would recommend it to anyone who needs these features. I would consider buying another one.

  1113. For something this cheap, the Gillette Fusion Proglide is very well made. Powered by Braun, it is sturdy, lightweight and waterproof. It has a trimmer (for contouring and edging), three combs (sizes 1, 2, and 3, which provide different trim levels), and a razor blade (you can easily buy replacements) for shaving.<br /><br />Powered by a single AA battery (which should last about a month of average use), the black rubber contours provide a firm grip. The power button is located beneath, and ejecting the attachment requires sliding the arrowed switch on top.<br /><br />Also provided is a nice plastic stand which houses the unit and attachments.<br /><br />Most importantly, it does its job very well and gives me a clean shave, as well as a comfortable trim of even the nether regions. I'm pleased as punch.

  1136. When I found out I was going to be lucky enough to try this trimmer out via a free program provided by Gillette, I was pretty stoked. I've had a beard for probably over half my life now, and the handheld, battery powered trimmers I've tried in the past have never really worked that well. Hair clippers are great, but don't provide a lot of precise control for tight lines. My hope was that the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer would be better at the things I didn't like about what I had used in the past. For the most part, it succeeded, but not on all fronts.<br /><br />When I first got the trimmer and dug through the package, I was surprised at the weight it had. I have used battery powered (both rechargeable and not) trimmers in the past and they all felt flimsy and too light. This one does not. It only uses a single AA battery, but has a nice feel due to its overall weight. It feels very solid and well put together. The rubber grips have the right amount of tackiness to not feel sticky, but they are easily held when the trimmer is wet.<br /><br />The package contains a little stand to put the trimmer and its attachments in. It's useful to me, but I can see others thinking it's a little too clunky. Along with the stand, there are 3 guards and a tool to affix a razor to the trimmer, more on that later. The various guards are nice but I think it bears mentioning that they are all rather short. If you are someone who wants to use this as a beard trimmer and have a beard longer than 1/4 of an inch, this won't work for you. It also would have been nice to know the guards lengths, but they are only labeled 1, 2 and 3.<br /><br />I snapped the number 3 guard on and got to trimming. I typically keep my beard around 1/2 inches long but that wasn't an option for me as the guard was too short. I'm actually rather pleased with the shorter length (which I am guessing is 1/4 of an inch) seeing the final result and might be keeping it like this for a while. This is where the trimmer was somewhat disappointing to me, however. I was expecting it to be a beard trimmer and while I certainly got through my rather thick and long beard with it, it took a long time. My expectations might be more my fault than the products though, as it's hard to expect a battery-powered handheld to replace what a hair clippers can do. While it took a while to get through the jungle that was on my face, it did a good job and I think if I kept my beard trim, trimming the entire thing would be much easier.<br /><br />After getting the entire beard to length, I used the trimmer, minus any guard, to get the lines of my beard how I wanted. This is where I fell in love with this thing. The trimmer blades are perfect for getting lines down to a very finite detail. If you wanted to trim a Batman logo on your face, this is the tool to do it with. The smaller size, when compared to clippers (which was my standard go-to for my beard's lines), is perfect to do exactly what you want from a design perspective and it trims shorter hair very, very well. Once I got the lines done, I got a quick review from the fiancé and she said that she had never seen the lines look as good as they did after using this trimmer. If she approves, you know I do, too.<br /><br />The last step was to snap the razor attachment (see my separate review on the razor blades) on and shave the non-beard locations of my face and my head as well. I've been shaving my head with razors for the last 10+ years of my life. Typically I used a more standard sized handle razor to do this, but this was another thing I loved about the trimmer. Being able to have the extra size, weight and rumble of the motor in the trimmer, while attached to the razor, is wonderful. It just feels better to shave with it. So much so I can't see myself going back to a smaller handle.<br /><br />The last thing that impressed me about the trimmer was the fact I can actually spring the trimmer bladesfrom the body of the unit a bit to get rid of any excess hair that gets trapped, making this really easy to take care of and clean. As I noted before, the overall build quality is fantastic and this speaks to that.<br /><br />Overall, I was impressed with the trimmer. I don't think it can replace my clippers when I need to trim a lot of length off my beard, but in tandem with clippers I think the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer is going to be something I use long term to get the smaller details of my beard down as well as using the razor attachment to do my general shaving. Gillette did a nice job of making something inexpensive not feel cheap and I'm pretty happy to use this going forward.
  1137. Wow.... I had heard a lot about this little wonder. I never expected it to do so well. I have used many different razors and many different trimmers, this however took grooming to an all new level. I was so excited when I received one for free through a promotion ran by Gillette.<br /><br />When I first removed this little beauty from the packaging, I was a little confused as to what parts to keep and what parts where disposable packaging.   1161. So I recently decided to try growing a goatee, but as my past attempts have always ended within a week (usually after a shaping accident, I give up), I didn't want to spend a tremendous amount on a trimmer. While I didn't buy this device through amazon (it had a couple weeks wait, while the local drug store had it on the shelf), I did pick one up and here are my impressions:<br />1. Sufficient in terms of comb selection and power - there are 3 combs to adjust trim length and while they're all fairly similar, the 1 keeps a nice close cropped goatee while a 2 lets it have a little bit more length<br />2. The \\"power shave\\" feature, while okay, is something I will never use (that is, the regular razor head). Reason? 22 bucks for 4 blades. Absolutely insane. I'll stick with my safety razor.<br />3. Battery life is absolutely AWFUL. I've had it for less than a month and, one body grooming session aside (worked great btw), have used it on average twice a week for quick shavings...and have had to change batteries twice already. While it's only one double A battery, it's kinda ridiculous to have THAT short a battery life.<br /><br />Over all, the styler is fine. The blade itself isn't really as sharp or fine as more expensive units, making shaving edges a bit more of a challenge than with a higher end trimmer, however after a month of use it's still going strong and hasn't fallen apart (as other reviewers have stated their units have).<br /><br />If what you want is a real entry level trimmer, I see no reason to spend any more than I did on this one. It's cheap, its easy, its maintenance free (other than battery changes) and it does a sufficient job of keeping my beard neat and tidy. Works well for body hair grooming as well - though again you better keep a stash of batteries on hand.
  1162. The proglide power razor that comes in the package is pretty good even with tough beards. The Styler that can be used as handle can be used as handy trimmer but not for tough beards. The blade width of Styler is less and for those who trim more often rather than shaving it might not be a good choice. But it is good enough to trim to finesse the sideburns or style your beard. A very good purchase for the price..

The reason why the styler is not 5 stars is because the trimmers battery could be a little longer. The other reason is that when the trimmer gets a little wet it slows down a lot and doesn't cut as well. Overall I am very satisfied though.

  1169. When I first purchased this product I was amazed. It worked so well, especially for the price. Like I expected, the usual close shave with the Fusion Proglide Power blades, but the trimmer, wow! It does work...<br /><br />If your willing to purchase expensive batteries, otherwise you'll end up spending a ton of money just on batteries! I had to buy Energizer Ultimate Lithium batteries in order to get full power for a good amount of time. Otherwise, if you buy cheap dollar store batteries, after two uses you'll feel significantly less power than when you first bought it, trust me. And if you have less power, expect to have your facial hair repeatedly tugged on which of course is painful.<br /><br />I've used it over 15 times AT LEAST (and I don't use it every time I shave --- I don't shave often) with the expensive Energizer batteries.<br /><br />I've never had a large enough beard to use the add-ons with the trimmer, although the first time I used it, it worked very well, even though I did not have a large beard. Now, it seems to no longer work very good.<br /><br />Anyways, I wouldn't recommend this product any longer and why? #1 batteries. #2 the Fusion Proglide blades are no longer any good. Dull, very dull, very quickly. They tug and pull and cut. In the end it looks like a scene from a horror movie. So yes, the trimmer works excellent if your willing to fork out $15 for two batteries, but not worth the purchase if your going to use Proglide blades.

  1176. This Gillette Fusion trimmer looks really cool and fits great in the hand too. It has a rubberized feel, and is battery operated, running on 1 AA battery, which is included. Battery operated trimmers can be a bit of a double-edged sword, since you need fresh batteries to give it all the cutting power that it's capable of. This trimmer comes with 3 different guards for beard trimming at different lengths, and a 4 blade shaving attachment as well. The trimmer is sharp and did a good job tidying up my beard. I don't think I'll be using the 4 blade shaver much, but it's an interesting idea to have it as an attachment on a trimmer. Everything's color coordinated, and looks good, and functions well too. It's nice and compact and doesn't take up a lot of room on my bathroom shelf, which is a plus. The base has compartments to hold all the attachments as well. The trimmer is not overly noisy which is also a big plus. I hate trimmers that rattle and buzz really loud. Here's a helpful manscaping tip: put the longest guard on the trimmer, and run it over your eyebrows, so you don't look like an unruly sasquatch! Oh and while we're at it, trim your ear and nose hair too sometimes. There's devices better than this for those purposes, but if you don't have the appropriate ear and nose trimmer, this will make do. I'm always surprised at how many men walk around with disgustingly long ear and nose hair; and I'm not just talking about older men. It's gross, guys, and doesn't make you look cool or tough. Overall, this is a great little trimmer, and would be excellent for travel, given the size.

  1195. I was *super* excited to try this new razor out. I don't particularly like shaving with a razor, and I often opt to use an electric trimmer. However, even the best electric trimmer only gets so close to the skin -- a razor always gets closest. So the prospect that a product finally combined the best of both worlds (that is, a razor to get real smooth in some places, and an electric trimmer to trim other places), was pretty inviting and exciting. However, this device didn't deliver. Even without any clips/combs attached (and this razor comes with 3), hardly any hair was removed from my face -- definitely not a very good \\"edging\\" device, as advertised. With the combs on, again, hardly any hair is removed -- I even tried shaving an area of my leg just for the hell of out (and my legs are very hairy) to no avail -- doesn't look like I took a trimmer to them at all. As far as the razor goes, it's as good as any Gillette razor blade -- however, I don't think the motor adds much to the experience, and, moreover, attached to this hefty handle, it makes shaving excessively bulky and awkward.

  1200. Had been looking at getting one of the these for a while, but never committed. Got lucky and got this free from Gillette to give it a go. Wish I would have gotten one a long time ago because it is great. The styler goes an awesome job of being a shaver, trimmer and trimmer with guides. The ease of is one of the winning features. One push button controls both the trimmer and vibration for the shaver. Also it is very simple to switch from shaving to trimming and back again. The blade snaps on to shave and pushing another button pushes the blade off allowing to you use the trimmer. It's also nice how it comes with the three separate guides. This offers a really easy way to get things the length you want instead of eye balling it.<br />While most of the styler is super easy to use I do with wish the trimmer guides were a little more user friendly. With the guides on the trimmer it's not completely clear if the trimmer should be held horizontally or more vertically in comparison to what your shaving. I have had the best results holding the trimmer in a more horizontally position when trimming things up. Would definitely recommend this to only one that wants one thing to both shave and trim.

  1223. I received this razor as part of a promotion from Gillette, so I didn't know what to expect. Opening the Gillette Fusion ProGlide was exciting. On first touch it was light and stylish by itself. I immediately tried out the trimmer heads and did a little mustache work. Though not obvious from the instructions, it was fairly easy to figure out which head was which. And without the guard, a clean straight line was easy to accomplish.<br /><br />The trimmer is a bit smaller than others, but that's perfect in retrospect, because it allows for easy maneuverability around edges, affording you the ability to see the whole picture (think, making a clean cut around a beard line, or under the mustache). Other larger trimmers can leave zig-zag lines when the edges go out farther than you think (I have actually lost corners on my mustache from other trimmers).<br /><br />Using the same handle to shave with is another plus... it means one less thing to lose or one less handle to have hanging on the counter all the time.<br /><br />Two small \\"cons\\" if I must:<br />1) It's not completely clear that the entire unit can be used in the shower. I'm still not certain if the unit is sealed and what to do after it gets wet. There are also no cleaning or lubricating instructions for the trimmer blade (if necessary, how often should it be cleaned? What is the life expectancy of the unit overall?).<br /><br />2) The packaging looks great, but if this is supposed to be used for a case or stand, again it's not clear what do do with the extra blades when buying a multi-pack (I assume they are sold as multi-packs, based on past experience). I would prefer, for the sake of all the plastic, to have a full \\"Stand\\" that accommodates multiple blades, and maybe even a carry-case for traveling.<br /><br />On the whole, I'd give it an 90, and I am sure I will use it over and over and over again.

  1226. I received the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer as part of a program running through Gillette. First, I was pretty impressed with how the trimmer and add-ons were packaged. It wasn't shoddy or careless packaging, they really did a good job making sure all the components were properly secured.<br /><br />After unpacking the trimmer I was surprised by its heft. It didn't feel like cheap materials or anything. I liked that it felt solid and durable in my hand. The trimmer comes with an additional razor attachment for close shaves, as well as numbers 1, 2, and 3 trimming guides so you have options for how close you want your beard or hair trimmed. There is also a stand that holds every attachment for a convenient display next to your bathroom sink. Also, it comes with an AA battery already installed so all you have to do is unpack it and turn it on, simple as that.<br /><br />Using the trimmer, I was a little skeptical. Previously, I've really only had experience with the trimmer attached to my electric razor and it did okay, but I could never quite get the look I wanted because I had to have a steady hand and judge hair length on my own. I had many accidents where I accidentally trimmed my beard too much on one side so I had to even it out on the other side and it ended up being a mess afterwards. So when I first started using the trimmer I wasn't exactly sure what to expect.<br /><br />Well, I quickly grasped how powerful the trimmer is. It cuts hair like butter which was a welcome surprise in comparison to my electric razor's trimmer. I started using the ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer more and quickly was able to get smooth, clean edges around my beard and it already looked way better after just a couple minutes of use than it ever did with my electric razor. I attached the number 2 guide to the trimmer and confidently started moving it up and down across my beard without fear of it cutting closer than I wanted it to. The guide does a fantastic job ensuring you that it won't trim off too much. I switched to the number 1 guide for the top part of my beard for a light fade and it worked very well. In about three to four minutes I was completely done grooming my beard and it looked awesome.<br /><br />So before I started using the ProGlide trimmer I did not maintain my beard much at all because it was such a hassle with my electric razor. I usually only attempted it once or twice a week. Now, I actually look forward to the morning to touch it up again and make sure it looks its best each day. The trimmer is a breeze to clean, too. It's such an easy and convenient tool to have and even if you're only into shaving, the razor blade add-on cuts close enough to replace any conventional razor you have now.<br /><br />Overall, I've been very impressed with the ProGlide Power Trimmer.

The razor blade and the trimmer attachments slide onto the handle and a small eject button easily removes them.<br /><br />The entire kit comes together in a small package, about the size of a new razor, and the components fit together in a plastic holder so you can keep things organized and not just sliding around in a drawer.<br /><br />All in all this will definitely find a permanent home in my bathroom for my future grooming needs.

  1285. I actually received this Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler through a program run by Gillette. If you have been letting your beard grow for a while and want to trim, this isn't for you. This trimmer is good for daily users or every-other-day users.<br /><br />Don't expect this trimmer to trim every hair on the first try Its definitely not that powerful. You will have to run it over your beard over and over before its nice and even. If you have curly beard like me, it's going to take a while to trim it. Another down side with curly beard is that you might have to clean during the trim because the hair gets stuck in the \\"little compartment\\" which is very easy to clean though. You can hear the hair getting stuck in the trimmer by the sound it starts making. However, this wasn't a big issue for me since it very easy to clean but it may be for others.<br /><br />For the price, you cannot complain about build quality. I don't expect is to last me years but maybe several months or a year or so. It seems very sturdy in the hand while trimming. I thought the attachments clips would break after couple of times but after being used for couple of weeks, by 2 men (me and my dad), it just like new. The styler has a rubber outing on it for a better grip. The size is just great; it's very easy to hold in your hands. It makes you feel like you're in control of where it goes. It works in the shower as well. It comes with a \\"caddy\\" which holds your razor, styler, and the attachments. For the price, you would expect it be cheap looking but honestly it is not.<br /><br />I have cleaned other body hair with this and its completely painless and effortless. All in all, I would highly recommend this product. The only cons, I noticed were the hair getting stuck in that little area and perhaps it being little more powerful so it got perhaps get all the hair in the first try. But the pros outweigh the cons. I would buy this again and especially for a vacation.

  1328. This razor was provided for free via a program run by Gillette.<br /><br />I will be reviewing the Gillette Fusion Proglide Styler as compared to my typical go-to razor for the past few years since this is all I have to use as a comparison.<br /><br />Blades:<br />The blades on the Gillette Fusion give me an exceptionally smooth shave. Of the 8 times over the past few weeks that I have shaved, I have felt no tugging that I typically feel when using my triple bladed razor. I have also noticed that my face also feels slightly smoother for a longer period of time than my usual razor. Even with over a week of facial hair, the blade was able to easily remove all hair without any tugging! That is very impressive coming from my old razor.<br />One drawback is that I have never been able to overcome getting the areas under my trouble spots cleanly shaven in just one pass (the jaw joint area - TMJ) regardless of the razor brand. It always seems to take multiple passes in multiple directions in this area even when using the Gillette Fusion.<br /><br />Trimmer:<br />The trimmer on the Gillette Fusion is a nice touch. I usually wait about a month to cut my own hair using electric hair clippers. In the meantime, the hair around my ears starts to make me look really ragged. The trimmer allows me to quickly take care of this issue without me having to pull out my clippers. The Gillette Fusion trimmer is good enough to do a quick maintenance job.<br /><br />Waterproof:<br />This feature does not matter to me since I do not shave in the shower, nor to I have the urge to shave underwater. But, I'm sure Aquaman would really dig this feature.<br />My old razor was equally waterproof, but did not have a battery pack.<br /><br />Cost:<br />This is the biggest drawback for the Gillette Fusion. Typically I purchase an 8 pack of my usual razor blades for around $10, and this razor kit alone costs around $18. Plus, a replacement pack of 8 blades currently costs around $32 on Amazon. Being frugal (cheap), that price is a little high for me. It works out to about $1.25 per blade vs. $4 per blade plus the cost of the kit. On the positive side, the blades can last a month or more, so in the long run, I could make a case that the replacement blades are really not much more expensive. My other blades last less than 2 weeks, and then I start to get major tugging. If you can find some coupons, then it is definitely worth it.<br /><br />Overall:<br />If you are willing to dish-out a little extra cash, you can expect a very smooth and comfortable shaving experience while also keeping the maintenance up on the hair around your ears.<br /><br />4 out of 5 stars
  1329. When I first got this product I just thought it was just another trimmer, boy was I wrong. I could see and feel the difference and Its so much more convenience. I mean I don't have to shave with one product and then get a trimmer out. so the clean up is a lot faster too. My wife said my face was so smooth and I didn't have a five o'clock shadow.
  1330. First, I'm a big fan of Gillette products. They make quality products at affordable prices, and the Proglide Styler is no exception. I keep a goatee and the Proglide styler has really made my before-work routine much easier and much quicker. Before, I actually was using 3 -4 different tools for grooming--manual razor, trimmer, clippers and a few times a week, an electric foil razor. I used the trimmer for certain parts of my goatee, the manual razor for general face shaving, the clippers for the thick, beard part of my goatee and my eyebrows and the foil razor for touch-ups on my neck and jaw line. With the Proglide Styler, I've eliminated the use of the clippers for facial hair trimming, manual razor and the other trimmer--which didn't work NEARLY as well. The guides work great for trimming my goatee and brows, I love the subtle vibration when using the manual razor along with the power turned on--makes for a closer shave, in my opinion--, and the trimming blade is perfect for sideburns. The rubber grip--it;s rubber, not hard plastic--prevents drops and slips and is comfortable to hold, easy to guide and fits i hand nicely--not to bulky at all. I received my Proglide styler as a promo through Gillette, but would pay full price for it any day.Totally worth it, especially if you keep facial hair that needs trimming on a daily or few times a week basis.

  1337. I picked up one of these at the local drug store last night after having a coupon to get $3 off. I had a similar styler, but the blades were dull and a pain to groom myself with. It's quick, fast and easy to use, helping you to always look your best with all your quick grooming needs.<br /><br />For as cheap as the Gillette styler was, it sure is my new favorite tool to groom with! It's got a lot of nice features that more expensive stylers have, but for around only $20, plus it's water proof for use in the shower! First off let's start with the fact that it uses pro-glide fusion disposable cartridges, how amazing is that? I can now toss out my old fusion power pro-glide handle since this one works even better. The cartridge snaps right onto the top of the styler, and with the press of the on button, it vibrates just as well, if not better than the standard power handles on the disposable shavers.<br /><br />The handle is nicely molded, very clean look and provides maximum grip. The black is actually soft rubber, not hard plastic, so you won't find yourself dropping the styler or having it slip out of your palms. The power button is very small, but easy to press to turn the shaver on and off, the LED light is also nice and not blinding.<br /><br />You can use the standard motorized blade directly on your skin without worrying about cutting yourself, or scratching up your skin. It's sharp, but only for your hair. It also includes 3 different style \\"combs\\" to attach to the shaver so you can style your side burns, beard, mustache, anything else you'd want to trim. With all these little plastic attachments here and there though, you'll need a place to store it all! Gillette is two steps ahead of you, because the packing it comes in also doubles as a stand and accessory holder for the styler itself, and all the little attachments included.<br /><br />One nice thing not many shavers or stylers have is the ability to open the compartment behind the blade to clean out hair that can cause jams. The Gillette styler has a hatch you can pop off, and snap right back down to clean out any hair or gunk so your styler never jams, and will always work reliably. This is a huge plus for me since my old one was becoming weak and dull from all the hair trapped in the mechanism slowing down the blade and motor.<br /><br />Besides the styler and the accessories, I received Gillette brand cooling lotion to use after shaving, and non burning shaving gel. I tried both, and liked them very much. The shaving gel made my hairs pirk right up after a few seconds, making shaving so much easier. I felt no burn or sting while using the gel, so it really does work. Afterwards I put some of the lotion into my palms and rubbed it onto my face where I had shaved, it did have a nice cooling effect, but I could have lived without the lotion, it has a nice light scent to it too.<br /><br />For under $20, the Gillette Styler really can't be beat. It's cheap in price, high quality, comes with tons of accessories and samples, and it does a good job. It would make a great gift to any guy you know, or a gift to yourself!has a hatch you can pop off, and snap right back down to clean out any hair or gunk so your styler never jams, and will always work reliably. This is a huge plus for me since my old one was becoming weak and dull from all the hair trapped in the mechanism slowing down the blade and motor. Besides the styler and the accessories, I received Gillette brand cooling lotion to use after shaving, and non burning shaving gel. I tried both, and liked them very much. The shaving gel made my hairs pirk right up after a few seconds, making shaving so much easier. I felt no burn or sting while using the gel, so it really does work. Afterwards I put some of the lotion into my palms and rubbed it onto my face where I had shaved, it did have a nice cooling effect, but I could have lived without the lotion, it has a nice light scent to it too. For under $20, the Gillette Styler really can't be beat. It's cheap in price, high quality, comes with tons of accessories and samples, and it does a good job. It would make a great gift to any guy you know, or a gift to yourself!

  1419. After receiving the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer via a program run by Gillette, I stared at myself in the mirror, wondering on what I'd be using the system. Blessed with the ability to grow nothing more than hobo-stubble, I realized that it would take an act of God for me to grow a beard in time to trim it AND review this item. That being said, I definitely have sideburns, and being a grown adult, I also have....body....hair. With that in mind, I set about my task of trying out the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer, to see how it would stand up against other trimmers.<br /><br />To begin with, the form factor of the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer is fantastic. It's small and light, and being operated by nothing but batteries, it's easy enough to tuck into any shaving kit and take with you anywhere you might need a quick trim. Unlike plug-in trimmers, there's no real need to have this constantly plugged into the wall. This also makes it incredibly easy to utilize the biggest talking point of the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer, the fact that you can take it into the shower.<br /><br />Being that the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer can be used for more than a quick beard trim, and despite the fact that most folks won't talk about stuff like that, being able to take the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer into the shower means you can trim up from the floor up. Once you're finished trimming whatever it is you want to trim, you can give it a quick rinse and tuck it away for later. The razor. Tuck away the razor for later.<br /><br />The #1 Dermatologist Recommended Gillette Fusion ProGlide Power blades also make it incredibly easy to get baby's bottom smooth, and with the small form-factor, you can hug any curves you've got on your body. The safe and close blades mean you won't cut yourself, and good luck getting this thing to give you razor burn!<br /><br />Overall, I really like this little guy, and I'll continue to use it. Cleaning it is also easy with water. Alone, the trimmer isn't much more than a basic trimmer that is water resistant. Where this thing really shines is the whole Fusion Proglide kit. Now here I must mention that I received this trimmer for free from a program run by Gillette, and as such I needed to write a review on the trimmer. But I feel that the kit as a whole is what really makes this thing worth consideration. It comes with the trimmer, and 1, 2, and 3, setting length clipons, one Fusion Proglide razor blade (which attaches to the top of the trimmer pretty conveniently), and a nice little caddy to store everything together in one place. The whole kit comes together to provide a quick and easy method for most any manscaping maintnance.

  1528. I am typically an electric razor user. I hate nicks and the feeling of razor burn... plus I am not a big fan of the mess of the shaving cream and the stubble a razor leaves in the sink. Usually, it is much easier to just run the electric razor over my face on the way out the door.<br />Gillete gave me a free promo Fusion ProGlide Styler to try out. The ProGlide Styler is almost like a complete electric razor; both a blade to shave your face and small clippers with attaché=ments to trim up facial hair and sideburns.<br /><br />First, let me tell you about the blade itself. The clipper handle is an electric handle that vibrates when you draw the blade across your face. And the best part is that the blade is so great it just takes on pass over each area to provide a shave much smoother than my electric razor could ever do. Normally I need to make several passes; but not with the Fusion ProGlide blade. It actually took me less time to shave with Fusion ProGlide Styler than my Electric to get even better results than the electric.<br /><br />Nope! Not at all. I tried the Fusion ProGlide without the handle vibrating and the shave was everything I hate about blade razors. Turn the handle on and it is smoother than the electric and it only takes one pass instead of several. I had less irritation with the ProGlide than the electric. \\"Glide\\" indeed! The addition of the trimming tool could replace my electric shaver entirely.<br /><br />The only piece of this equipment that I am not 100% convinced will allow me to toss out an electric razor is the trimmer. It is small, and not very powerful. While it is good in a pinch, it is not extremely precise and took several passes to make my side burns look as good as normally get with my electric trimmers. Still, it is not bad, just not powerful and the trimming head is smaller.<br /><br />If you are looking to get back into the bladed razor world. I recommend the Fusion ProGlide Styler. The only bad thing I can say about it, is thatit still makes a mess in the sink and the trimming head is a little small. However... you can take this \\"electric\\" ProGlide handle into the shower (it is waterproof) so if you have a mirror in there, you are all set. Plus it has the different trimming head attachments that come with the razor, so it really is an all-in-one package. This is really great for traveling if you want a good professional clean shave, the ability to trim your facial hair and don't want to pack-up cords or a charger.

Utilizing a no-guard option will give you an all around 5-o'clock shadow look while sizing up with one of the guards will preserve desired hair length.<br />+ Good razor - The styler is an effective multi-tasker and becomes a great razor when you insert a Proglide cartridge (1 is included). This 5 bladed cartridge provides a tight and smooth shave and is compatible with Gillete's line of Proglide grooming products.<br />+ Waterproof - You can use this device while powered on in the shower and clean up is very simple and effective.   1542. I had a chance to try the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler thanks to Gillette. I have used this Styler trimmer for about 3 weeks now and really love it. From day one when I received the trimmer I noticed that the way it was built it felt like it would hold up for a long time. This system comes with a holster that holds the Gillette Fusion, Blades and Guards. When I opened the package they had everything packed very organized. It came with a AA Battery which was a shocker. The AA battery that came with this product is the same one that I am still using 3 weeks later and I have been using this Styler almost every day. I have noticed that wile using the trimmer part of it the trimmer head will start to get clogged. That does not bother me because I can wash it out but if you are in a hurry to get the trimming done and you have a thick mustache or beard then it may slow you down a little. I had a thick beard and it cut right thru it all like nothing until it got clogged up. The other plus about this product is it is waterproof. You can take it and use this in the shower if you would rather shave in the shower. Has a nice rubber grip on it so that it will not slip out of your hand. It also comes with 3 Guards so that you can trim your beard to a different size if you wanted to. I like these since they are not resizable because the resizable ones always wear out allot faster. These are set lengths. They fit nicely into the back of the holster. When they are wet they will drip thru the holster. The holster has holes for the water to run out. This trimmer also turns into a razor. When you pop the razor attachment on it and turn it on the blades of the razor will vibrate and cause your hair to stand up and get a closer cut.
  1543. The Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler is my new best friend! I got the free razor provided via a program run by Gillette and decided to give it a try. I do no have a huge beard, in fact, I don't like having a beard or shaving, so at first I was apprehensive about using this product and not sure I would love it.<br /><br />Boy, was I wrong. With it, the task I really hate, shaving, is so much easier and precise, leaving no stubs behind and giving me a very pretty and clean look!<br /><br />My beard is uneven and my skin gets irritated easily, so with the great razor, the ability to use it in the shower, on or off, make it a perfect item that I will for sure take anywhere I go!

  1548. (I have updates below. Read the original review for backstory only). ORIGINAL REVIEW I'm so pleased with this device. I had a Remington something or other that cost me around $50. To my disappointment, it wasn't even worth the $19.99 I later saw it selling for at a different store. So after over a year of anguishing under such tyranny, I decided it was time for an upgrade (and a less dramatic outlook on life). Enter the Proglide Styler (under $20!). The trimmer, when used with 1 of 3 combs, gives you fast and easy facial hair trimming. Pop off the comb to easily establish lines. Pop on the razor attachment and press the power button for what may be the closest, most comfortable shave you've ever had. Use the precision blade on the back of the razor to get those lines nice and sharp. It's even easy to clean. Just push the trimmer head back, rinse the hair-filled chamber, and you're done. The bottom line is, if you have facial hair, you should buy this product. I'll give an update in a few months, but I'm pretty sure this thing can do no wrong. UPDATE: April 18, 2014 So I've been using the Proglide Styler for a few months now and here's how I feel: I'm still very pleased with the Styler as a beard trimmer, but not so much as a razor. I like the precision blade on the back enough, but the razor itself, with or without the power on, cuts my neck like the dickens (that's right, the dickens). So lately, I've been using the much more comfortable Magnum 3 on my neck (with no major cuts and only the occasional little nick), and using the Styler's precision blade for cleaning up my lines, retiring the Styler's main razor entirely. And even the precision blade isn't that comfortable. In reality, you're probably better off using the Styler only as a beard trimmer, and getting a good, comfortable razor with a precision blade for shaving. As you can tell from my original review, I've radically changed my view on the razor component's quality (I even called it the &#34;closest, most comfortable shave you've ever had&#34;). But I guess the blades lose their goodness after the first use. UPDATE: July 2, 2014 Okay, so since my last update this device has proven even more unreliable than originally given credit for. After just a couple uses, the motor starts laboring like the batteries are about to die ('cause they are). Additionally, the plastic nib thing on the comb that clicks it into place will disintegrate and chip off, making the comb unusable unless you want to press your finger against the comb at all times to keep it from falling off. The trimmer itself isn't even that powerful, come to think of it. When I first reviewed this thing, I gave it 5 stars and sang its praises with no complaints. Now, I've taken it down to 2 stars and added a cautionary &#34;Or So I Thought&#34; to the title due to its faulty and flawed multi-blade razor, precision blade, battery life, and comb adapters. I don't know which beard trimmer out there is a good one to buy, but I intend to do so ASAP and throw this thing in the trash where it belongs. (See new update below) UPDATE: December 26, 2016 &#34;The Peanut&#34; by Wahl. Buy that. Only 3 adapters, and those 3 don't offer much length variety, but it's a good quality beard trimmer with plenty of power, thanks to the fact that it plugs in and doesn't run on batteries. Since my last update, I've thrown out the Proglide Styler, but I've actually bought another one because it makes an inexpensive waterproof trimmer for my...not my beard. So its low quality isn't as much of a problem. But it still sucks as a beard trimmer. Meep.
  1549. It's good product, but I purchased one in theorde number 104-7628990-4265053 in january 5, 2014 and it's missing 2 of 3 combs that was supposed to bring; and the base &#34;organizer&#34; is broken in the middle. So I lost it!

  1551. What can I say, this is a very good trimmer that operates on a AA battery. Cleans easily and the combs are easy to switch.   1552. I bought this solely for the beard trimmer, as I use Dollar Shave Club for my shaving needs (seriously, you should check them out. They are an inexpensive, well made alternative to the overpriced shave gear put out by Gillette. Hit me up and I'll send you a link, or Google it).<br />The trimmer seems to be made well. It has a heavier feel in the hand, which is something I appreciate--I don't like the feel of cheap plastic--and the blades/teeth do the job. There are two issues I have with it, which might be minor for some folks. First, it burns through batteries if you use it more than once a month, which I do. Because my beard grows in thick and full, if I don't shave for a week (which is common), I have to do a once over with a beard trimmer before I can shave. As a result I go through batteries fairly quickly with this. The other issue I have is the contour of the trimmer head. I find it more cumbersome trimming over my ears when cleaning up my sideburns. My last beard trimmer (which met an unfortunate and rusty demise at the hands of my unknowing wife, who assumed it could be rinsed off with water--a tale for another time) had more of an open trim head, allowing me to glide over my ears when shaping the burns. Not so much with this one. It's better for squaring things off, which would work well for me, if I sported, for instance, white walls; I grow a little something past the tops of my ears, and thus have to spend more time finessing areas that require more than a right angle.<br />All in all, this isn't a bad beard trimmer, it just isn't the greatest one I've used, and I will be buying a replacement for the one my wife accidentally destroyed (we could never have a robot child, because she would forget and try to bathe it).

  1619. I have very sensitive skin and have used a Gillette Fusion manual razor for years with much satisfaction. I have recently started experimenting with a beard during the cold Southern California winters and when I was offered the opportunity by Gillette to try the Fusion Proglide 3 in 1 Styler for free I decided why not!<br /><br />The trimmer itself works very well and has a design that allows for you to get very close, sharp edges when self trimming. The 3 additional combs it comes with fit easily to the trimmer and help you keep a consistent length, unless you want to grow it out Grizzly Adams style. I like the stand it comes with which compactly holds the 3 combs and the razor attachment, but the packaging the Styler came in was a little excessive. Using the razor attachment was a little awkward because of the thickness of the trimmer. My shave routine took some adjustment to accommodate the bulky handle. I'm sure it would be easy to get used to but I think I will stick with the Gillette Fusion Proglide Power razor, which I have found to give the closest shave. Finally, it is water proof, which is great for those of us who prefer to shave in the shower.<br /><br />In conclusion, if you already have a beard trimmer then this is probably unnecessary unless you want to have everything all in one compact apparatus. If you don't have a trimmer and need one, this trimmer is unbeatable for the price. The only real complaint I have is that I would like for it to be rechargeable instead of requiring batteries, but it is nice that batteries are included with the initial purchase. If you have a trimmer but need a good razor, I would recommend the Gillette Fusion Proglide Power razor (I know it's a mouthful). Fortunately both the Styler and the Power razor work with regular Gillette Fusion cartridges, which are just as good as the Proglide and Proglide Power cartridges in my opinion, so that will save you some dough!

I like the larger handle; it fits easily in the hand and has a reasonable weighty feel to it. I am giving it as gifts to family and friends.

  1674. Works really well and trims evenly! This was the first trimmer that I used outside of a regular electric razor to achieve the desired &#34;5 oclock shadow&#34; look. For the price, it didn't do a bad job!<br /><br />The trimmer comes with three different trim guards that keep the hair at desired lengths. As the hair on my face grows unevenly and somewhat patchy, I was able to alternate the guards to different parts of my face in order to achieve a consistent look. It works pretty good for that!<br /><br />It runs off of a double A battery that for me, lasts about 2 to 4 shaves. If you use rechargeable AA batteries, this shouldn't be much of a problem. However, it would have been nice if it was rechargeable. I would have paid more for that feature.<br /><br />The head is small which is really good for the under the nose area. A lot of the bigger trimmers have problems in that area. I also use it without the guard to thin out the denser portions of my facial hair and find it to be the perfect length for a 5 oclock shadow.<br /><br />You'll need to oil the blades from time to time. Once it stopped and I thought the battery was dead - switched it, and nothing! I thought the razor had died until I tried a little oil on the blades. It had just locked up after the course of a year. Now, it's still running just like when I bought it.<br /><br />The trimmer does get a little clogged in the shower, but overall very nice. Wish it was rechargeable, but at this price It's definitely worth trying!

  1711. I was recently given a free Gillette Fusion Proglide Styler Power Trimmer via a program run by Gillette. I already have a trimmer that I regularly use, but I thought it would be interesting to try out something new. I've had this trimmer for a few weeks, and if you're looking for a quick recommendation, then I can certainly say that the Proglide Styler is a great and versatile tool. However, if you're looking for an in-depth review, then read on. As a side note, this review only covers the trimmer even though it comes with a set of Proglide Power Blades.<br /><br />The first thing you'll notice about the trimmer is how well-built it is. The handle is larger in circumference than a traditional razor blade but it smaller than most traditional trimmers. Personally, the size of the handle suits me just fine. The handle, itself, is covered in an easy to grip rubber. You won't have any trouble gripping and holding on to this trimmer. In terms of appearance, the blue trim goes nicely with the traditional silver color that comes standard with most trimmers. The touch of blue might not seem like much, but it makes the product just look sleeker and more expensive. The trimmer is powered by a single AA battery, so there isn't a whole lot of weight to the trimmer although it also isn't so light that it becomes hard to handle.<br /><br />The trimming blades themselves work very nicely. The head of the trimmer is contoured in such a way that makes it easy to trim your facial hair. I used the trimmer for my mustache and goatee and had no trouble at all trimming around my lips and shaping my goatee. The single AA battery provides more than enough power to the trimmer, which allows you to trim and shave yourself cleanly. As for battery life, I've been using the trimmer every other day for the past 2-3 weeks, and the trimmer is still going strong. Some would probably prefer a rechargeable battery, and if that's the case, then it's easy enough to buy a pack of Sanyo Eneloop batteries.<br /><br />The trimmer also comes with 3 sets of guards for those that want to clean up their facial hair. There are some who might have preferred an adjustable guard, but in my opinion, the individual guards are the way to go. My previous trimmer had an adjustable guard that became unusable after a while because I pressed the guard too hard against my skin. The individual guards allow you to really do a thorough job of trimming your hair to an equal length. The largest guard is about one-half to three quarters of an inch, which is perfectly fine for me. However, if you like to grow your facial hair out longer, then this product won't work for that purpose.<br /><br />Although this product will primarily be used for facial hair trimming, the fact that it is waterproof means that you can use it in the shower to trim other areas of your body. I don't personally do this, but I can attest to the waterproof nature of this product as well as the well-built guards and strong power of the trimming blades. If you want to use this product to groom your body, then it will more than do the job provided that you are not looking to trim your hair to a length that is longer than the largest guard.<br /><br />The trimmer also comes with a base that holds the trimmer, guards and the blade (not reviewed here). The base is made of plastic, but it is sturdy and holds the trimmer and accessories without any problem. The base, itself, isn't very large. If bathroom counter space is sparse, it still shouldn't be difficult to find a spot for the base.<br /><br />Overall, I can't really find any flaws with this product other than the fact that it doesn't have a rechargeable battery. It is easy to handle, look sleek and performs well. I was passively looking for a new trimmer to replace my old one, so it was very nice to be able to get a free product from Gillette to try out. Based on my experience, I will continue to use this trimmer from here on out and would not hesitate to buy another one in the future.
  1712. The styler was good but I think it's a little under powered using just batteries. The replacement blades are also very expensive. All in all it's just okay.

I am able to get a nice easy even trim without any bumps or irritation.   1715. Having received the Gillette Brand \\"Fusion ProGlide Styler\\" from a promotional review program provided by the Gillette Company, I was surprised that such a small package consisting of a several plastic pieces (adapters), a razor and a battery powered handle could make such a difference in the way I groom my facial hair.<br /><br />As with all products, good packaging has to be able to catch the consumer's eyes. From the plastic box that Gillette's \\"Fusion ProGlide Styler\\" comes in, you can tell that this is probably going to be an expensive product. Surprisingly though, it retails for about $26.99 (in my local area) and for the price, it does what it sets out to do very well. I also liked the fact that the box it came in can also be used to store the set when its not in use.<br /><br />Teaming up with the Braun Company (known for their innovative Electric Shavers), Gillette has designed and produced a product that most men who groom their facial hair can appreciate, especially because of the clever and easy to use design.<br /><br />The Fusion ProGlide Styler comes with a powered \\"Styler\\" trimmer handle which doubles as a mini electric shaver (powered by a single cell \\"AA\\" sized battery) as well as the \\"Fusion\\" platform in which the \\"ProGlide\\" razor is placed on to. Also included are three adapters (made of plastic) which can snap on to the \\"Styler\\" trimmer handle to regulate the distance from the user's facial hair while trimming, so the facial hair length is evenly cut.<br /><br />The adapters for the \\"Styler\\" trimmer handle work very well and are designed to accommodate even the thickest, paintbrush like facial hair. The adapters are numerically labeled \\"1\\", \\"2\\" and \\"3\\" to indicate the size of the spacing between the trimmer blades and facial hair. The \\"1\\" adapter is for the shortest setting with the \\"3\\" adapter being for the longest setting.<br /><br />I like my goatee and mustache to be somewhat short but not face hugging, so I was quite impressed when Ifinally received the Gillette \\"Fusion ProGlide Styler\\" for review.<br /><br />Using the different adapters for the \\"Styler\\" trimmer handle, I found that the \\"2\\" setting is perfect for my preferred mustache length and the \\"3\\" adapter suits my preferred goatee length just right. Switching out the adapters is also very simple and easy to figure out. Even though the set does not apparently include detailed instructions, anyone with a little bit of technical common sense will be able to figure out how to swap out the \\"Fusion\\" adapters in no time.<br /><br />The nice part is that once I've achieved my preferred facial hair length with the trimmer, I can then finish the grooming job with the included \\"ProGlide\\" razor which provides a smooth shave without too much effort.<br /><br />Additionally, the vibration and sound of the \\"Styler\\" trimmer handle are easy to deal with as it does not vibrate so much as a plug-in electrical shaver/trimmer would so you can easily maneuver the trimmer around your desired trimming areas with precision. The battery life from a single cell (included in the set and a high quality \\"Duracell\\" brand battery, no less) is also surprising; I was able to get at least a good 6 trimming/shaving sessions in, averaging at about 10 minutes each session before the battery life started to affect the performance of the \\"Styler\\" handle. It would still cut fine, but you would have to make more passes at the particular area you wanted to trim. (Always remember to change the battery out once you start to see a drop in performance)<br /><br />Overall, I'm very impressed at this entire set. Before I had the opportunity to receive a sample set to review, I was already considering purchasing this product from my local big-box store (i.e. Target, Wal-Mart, etc.) simply because I wanted to have a facial hair trimmer/razor that was not only compact but could handle the more precise trimming jobs such as my mustache hair, which a normal razor cannot trim effectively and larger electric shears/razors cannot do with precision.<br /><br />Gillette has finally released a product that I am very pleased with. I will definitely be purchasing replacement razors for the set because everything works so well. As for the \\"Styler\\" trimmer handle, I can't believe that such a great product is available for less than the $29.99 MSRP.<br /><br />I've been using Gillette Brand \\"Mach 3\\" razors for over 10 years. Now I guess its time to upgrade to the new \\"Fusion ProGlide\\" razors since they're a part of my new favorite facial trimmer set. Not to say I'll give up using the \\"Mach 3\\" razors; I'll just use them as my travel razors since they are also high quality razors.

The Fusion ProGlide Styler combines an excellent razor and an easy to use trimmer in one light, compact device.   1753. First of all, I should say that I did receive this free from a program run by Gillette.<br /><br />When I received this package, I was impressed with the compact size of the clear plastic \\"shell\\" it came packaged in. After fighting with it a few minutes just to get it open...not so impressed. Once it was open, removing the plastic pieces was also a bit of a challenge. It is obvious that the pieces were meant to stay in place to look nice through the clear plastic shell, but they are not easy to remove. After I wrestled the stand out of its shell, things made a bit more sense, and the little guides fit easily into slots in the back of the stand.<br /><br />I was initially impressed with the look of the trimmer itself...it is sleek, with a very attractive black and blue color scheme...kind of futuristic, if you ask me. It feels heftier than one would think, with a good \\"rubbery\\" grip that I liked. However, the power button on the underside of the trimmer is poorly placed; I turned the trimmer off many times accidentally during trimming. When the razor is attached, the whole contraption feels a bit contrived, and is long enough to look silly and feel a bit imbalanced.<br /><br />The razor works as it should. If you've used Gillette multi-bladed razors before, you know what to expect (but as previously mentioned, when attached to the long trimmer, there is a sacrifice in comfort and precision due to the unwieldiness). The vibration doesn't do anything, as far as I can tell, to help with a shave. It just feels gimmicky.<br /><br />Where this combo really failed for me was the trimmer's usefulness. It really isn't powerful enough to shave a thick beard or mustache efficiently. In fact, it took me about four to five times going over each area to really get most of the stray whiskers to the same length. When I passed the trimmer through a week's worth of beard, the motor slowed down considerably, and one could hear it get lower in pitch as it did so. One nice thing about the trimmer? The guides were compact, and rounded, so there was none of the \\"nose-poking\\" that occurs sometimes with long, sharp guides, and I felt that the whiskers on my philtrum were trimmed easier and better than average.<br /><br />I feel that this product doesn't do anything that a separate razor and trimmer would do better. I can't imagine someone buying replacement batteries for the trimmer, or heads for the razor portion. It would do in a pinch for a weekend away with no grooming supplies, but that's the extent of its usefulness.

I love it.<br />I received this for free via a program from Gillette, but I wish I had known about this sooner.

  1757. In a nutshell: If you can get it at a good price, buy it!<br /><br />Full review (written by my husband): Gilette Fusion ProGlide Styler: I received this product for free as per a Gilette promotional program. GREAT product, just marketed & packaged wrong. All it is is a nice electric trimmer which they've combo'd with a blade razor. I've read several books on marketing. It amazes me that large companies with millions of dollars at their disposal continue to make elementary marketing mistakes:<br /><br />Mistake #1: Trying to make an all-in-one product. With rare exceptions, it's normally a bad idea. In this case, they're trying to dazzle you with a product that \\"does it all\\" rather than separate trimmer and razor tools. However, instead of 2 tools, you now have one base plus four LITTLE attachments that are easily lost. The pretty box is actually cumbersome for storage so you'd have to find your own special box.<br /><br />Mistake #2: Brand confusion. It's a Gilette razor with apparently a Braun trimmer with the Gilette name slapped on it, though it's \\"Braun technology.\\" So is it a Gilette or Braun trimmer? And should blade market leader Gilette be in the electric trimmer business?<br /><br />Another Problem: They went way overboard with packaging making the product look much fancier than it really is, which 1) means I'm paying for that packaging, 2) more plastic in our landfills, and 3) VERY DIFFICULT TO OPEN - it took me 5 minutes to figure out how to get the razor part out!<br /><br />Breakthrough: If you ignore the blunders above, you can actually salvage a terrific product from this kit! My suggestion:<br /><br />1. Forget the razor blade attachment - just take off the blade refill which you can use as a free blade for the standalone Fusion razor you probably already own (and enjoy).<br /><br />2. Of the three combs, pick out your favorite length, then put the others in a secure place.<br /><br />3. Use the trimmer normally. For edging, take off the comb and hold it in your hand while you edge. When done put the comb back on so it doesn't get lost.<br /><br />TRIMMER PROS:<br /> * Very compact size - I can even edge my mustache easily<br /> * Watertight battery compartment<br /> * Takes only 1 battery + easy to change<br /> * Looks like good price even with all the packaging & razor extras you have to pay for<br /> * Trims/edges well (better than my cheapy generic trimmer)<br /> * Easy to put on/off combs<br /><br />TRIMMER CONS:<br /> * Combs are separate (as opposed to a comb with slide-adjustable length) and could get broken/lost<br /> * Confusing marketing (do I tell my friend to purchase a Gilette or Braun trimmer? I'd probably have to show him a photo of the whole pkg. to ensure he bought the right thing)<br /><br />BOTTOM LINE: Yes! It is worth buying - follow the easy 1-2-3 recipe above.
