  1762. I was recently given a free Gillette Fusion Proglide Styler Power Trimmer via a program run by Gillette. I already have a trimmer that I regularly use, but I thought it would be interesting to try out something new. I've had this trimmer for a few weeks, and if you're looking for a quick recommendation, then I can certainly say that the Proglide Styler is a great and versatile tool. However, if you're looking for an in-depth review, then read on. As a side note, this review only covers the trimmer even though it comes with a set of Proglide Power Blades.<br /><br />The first thing you'll notice about the trimmer is how well-built it is. The handle is larger in circumference than a traditional razor blade but it smaller than most traditional trimmers. Personally, the size of the handle suits me just fine. The handle, itself, is covered in an easy to grip rubber. You won't have any trouble gripping and holding on to this trimmer. In terms of appearance, the blue trim goes nicely with the traditional silver color that comes standard with most trimmers. The touch of blue might not seem like much, but it makes the product just look sleeker and more expensive. The trimmer is powered by a single AA battery, so there isn't a whole lot of weight to the trimmer although it also isn't so light that it becomes hard to handle.<br /><br />The trimming blades themselves work very nicely. The head of the trimmer is contoured in such a way that makes it easy to trim your facial hair. I used the trimmer for my mustache and goatee and had no trouble at all trimming around my lips and shaping my goatee. The single AA battery provides more than enough power to the trimmer, which allows you to trim and shave yourself cleanly. As for battery life, I've been using the trimmer every other day for the past 2-3 weeks, and the trimmer is still going strong.<br /><br />The trimmer also comes with 3 sets of guards for those that want to clean up their facial hair. There are somewho might have preferred an adjustable guard, but in my opinion, the individual guards are the way to go. My previous trimmer had an adjustable guard that became unusable after a while because I pressed the guard too hard against my skin. The individual guards allow you to really do a thorough job of trimming your hair to an equal length. The largest guard is about one-half to three quarters of an inch, which is perfectly fine for me. However, if you like to grow your facial hair out longer, then this product won't work for that purpose.<br /><br />Although this product will primarily be used for facial hair trimming, the fact that it is waterproof means that you can use it in the shower to trim other areas of your body. I don't personally do this, but I can attest to the waterproof nature of this product as well as the well-built guards and strong power of the trimming blades. If you want to use this product to groom your body, then it will more than do the job provided that you are not looking to trim your hair to a length that is longer than the largest guard.<br /><br />The trimmer also comes with a base that holds the trimmer, guards and the blade (not reviewed here). The base is made of plastic, but it is sturdy and holds the trimmer and accessories without any problem. The base, itself, isn't very large. If bathroom counter space is sparse, it still shouldn't be difficult to find a spot for the base.<br /><br />Overall, I can't really find any flaws with this product other than the fact that it doesn't have a rechargeable battery. It is easy to handle, look sleek and performs well. I was passively looking for a new trimmer to replace my old one, so it was very nice to be able to get a free product from Gillette to try out. Based on my experience, I will continue to use this trimmer from here on out and would not hesitate to buy another one in the future.

  1853. I received this product via a program run by Gillette.<br />I used the Fusion Pro-glide around 1 year. Now this is another amazing Gillette product .<br />First , this little AA-battery-powered trimmer and razor attachment is great for home use and travel. It comes with a useful plastic stand that keeps the trimmer, razor attachment, and three comb attachments all neatly stored on your bathroom counter. And for travel, it all fits easily into a small toiletries bag.<br /><br />Second ,the handle is nicely molded, very clean look and provides maximum grip. The black is actually soft rubber, not hard plastic, so you won't find yourself dropping the styler or having it slip out of your palms. The power button is very small, but easy to press to turn the shaver on and off, the LED light is also nice and not blinding.<br /><br />Third , the 5-blade razor is quick and sharp by itself, but when you couple it with the vibrating powered trimmer handle, you actually do get an even closer shave, even though it took me a few shaves to get used to the feeling. The back of the 5-blade razor has a \\"precision edging blade\\" that lets you precisely shape and edge your sideburns. How amazing is that .!!You can use the standard motorized blade directly on your skin without worrying about cutting yourself, or scratching up your skin. It's sharp, but only for your hair. It also includes 3 different style \\"combs\\" to attach to the shaver so you can style your side burns, beard, mustache, anything else you'd want to trim.<br /><br />One nice thing not many shavers or stylers have is the ability to open the compartment behind the blade to clean out hair that can cause jams. The Gillette styler has a hatch you can pop off, and snap right back down to clean out any hair or gunk so your styler never jams, and will always work reliably. This is a huge plus for me since my old one was becoming weak and dull from all the hair trapped in the mechanism slowing down the blade and motor.

  1856. I had the opportunity to try out one of the Gillette Fusion Proglide style power trimmer through a program run by Gillette. I work in a large office environment and have a clean shaven head with a beard, which means I have daily maintenance to keep myself well groomed. The proglide has worked far better than I expected. Being battery operated, there are no cords to deal with. It came with 3 separate length guards so you can allow for different lengths in different places. The whole kit comes with a nice looking stand that my wife didn't even mind it being out on the counter instead of banished to one of the drawers. If you are on the fence as to buy one or not I definitely recommend it.
  1857. I received my free proglide styler through a program from Gillette. I looked at the razor and found the sleek and stylish handle very appealing. I opened the package and held the razor. It fit perfectly in my hand. I have been an avid user of Gillette products as long as I can remember and this handle is by far the most comfortable to use out of any razor/trimmer they have made in the past. My hand fit perfectly around the sleek handle. The trimmer is a slim style with three trimmer attachments each a different length. Once done trimming just pop open the trimmer blade for quick cleaning under the faucet and then snap it back up and you are set to go. The only down side to this perfect trimmer is that it takes a single AA battery and is NOT a rechargeable. Aside from that, I find no other down falls.
  1858. My least favorite part about getting my hair cut is when they use the trimmer on the back of my neck. The trimmers they use feel like a mix of sand paper and razor blades. I always like to do a little touch up in between haircuts. When I tried the Gillette Power Trimmer through a trial program, the trimmer was soft to the touch and didn't leave my neck red and swelling like the barber. I may just bring the Gillette Power Trimmer with me next time I get my haircut.<br /><br />It works so gently, that I've used it to trim up my 2-year old son's neckline.
  1859. I recently received a free Gillette Fusion Proglide Style Power Trimmer from a Gillette promotion. I received the trimmer about a week ago and have been using it daily for manscaping and facial hair. The trimmer came with three attachments for different lengths of hair, and an attachment that uses a Gillette Proglide razor cartridge. The trimmer works very well for trimming hair no matter the location of your body. It is very much like a regular hair trimmer found a hair salon or a barber shop. The only problem I find with this trimmer is that it is very narrow. Unlike other hair trimmers it does not cover a large surface area. If you are looking to use this trimmer for trimming the edges of a recent hair cut or maintain a short length of body hair on sensitive body parts, this trimmer works perfectly. However, if you are looking for a trimmer that can be used as a primary hair clipping tool, it will work but is slightly small requiring more passes than that of a regular trimmer.

I would highly recommend this to the traveling professional!

  1926. I rarely give 5 out of 5 stars, but I think Gillette has a very good, innovative product here. I've been using their Mach III turbo razor for some time now and a Norelco styler for my goatee and 'burns. Norelco has made quality shavers and trimmers for many many years, And the Gillette Mach III is a very good razor. But I have to tell you the Fusion ProGlide will shave you smooth as a baby's bottom, I kid you not. The styler part uses Braun technology, and works very well. The three guards produce very good results with minimal getting used to. The handle is thick because it incorporates the battery and trimmer motor, so this part will take a bit of getting used to for shaving if you're used to a thin handled non powered shaver. Some have been claiming to have problems with theirs, such as the trimmer motor giving out, easily broken guards. I will admit the guard hooks and latch seem a bit thin, but as long as you're not ham-fisted with them they hold up well, and Gillette is always good about replacing a defective or broken item if you tell them, they've been good to me. At 14 bucks at Amazon online online and 18 bucks in-store at Walmart, you can't go wrong to give it a try. And yes, it will make an excellent gift or stocking stuffer. It's actually fun to use. I've had mine for two months and the novelty hasn't worn off, lol. The downside? The blades. They are expensive like the Mach III's blades, but they last a while, at least they do for me. Don't know if I'm quite ready to put away my Norelco trimmer yet, but it's not getting used much now. A solid 4 stars. Good job, Gillette.

I have used eneloop rechargeable batteries in it the whole time, works perfectly! After using it for a while and loving the convenience I purchased another (gold box deal) as I figured it'd break at some point soon, given the price & my experience with other, more expensive trimmers. The new one sits unused in the original box - but I'm still glad to have it.<br /><br />I'm 100% satisfied... I have ordered the Silver Swivel version (w/o trimmer) so that may shift my thinking some, by I look forward to years more use of the trimmer (and the interchangeability on blades with the swivel as needed).<br /><br />Possible Improvement: One thing I wish it had (barring adding the swivel if I like that) is an ear/nose trimmer blade guard/attachment - but that certainly doesn't warrant loss of a star!<br /><br />If you use a trimmer with any regularity at all (or if you don't, but should...) buy this now! You'll be thrilled you did!

  1943. I purchased this razor not too long ago. Not from amazon. However, Its lasted me quite some time.. Its great, affordable.. Its easy to clean and its great for shower use. The only issue, is it takes awhile to trim and shave with.. there isn't enough power in the motor to really get all of the hairs in one go.. but if you just rub it along your face a few times you get a decent trim. I SUGGEST!!! you purchase trimmer oil!! After awhile the blades on the trimmer dulled to the point where it pulls hair... Do to the friction creating heat, it dulls the blade fast.. that plus water on it a lot can dull it.. my fault for not keeping the blades oiled...But its decent trimmer..

I tried giving myself a trim this morning and it caught 6+ times, a few times coming to a complete stop.   1981. At first I was a little wary about purchasing this product because of the price. When I saw that Gillette was running a program to try it free I jumped on it. From day one of using it I instantly fell in love with it. The handle is very easy to hold and maneuver on my face. This handle would be excellent for older users who have a hard time holding onto smaller ones. It feels like you're not shaving at all. It glides along my face without any drag or pulling and cuts very close with one swipe and never nicks. My face feels incredibly smooth even hours later. The attachments are easily removed and changed making it an all in one product with everything at my fingertips. Before I would shave with a competitor's brand then use a scissor to trim my mustache and then use another trimmer to even everything out. Now I have everything in one handle saving me time and the trouble of looking for everything. I would have to change blades every three to four days because they wore out and cut my face let alone the razor burn. I have been using the Gillette Fusion Proglide for a week now ( My wife took it in the shower to do her legs) and it shaves as close and smooth as day one plus I could even skip a day if I want. YES it cuts that close without having to go over the same area three to four times. The only complaint I have is now I have to buy another one for my wife so she leaves mine alone. I would recommend this product to everyone young and old. \\"HINT!!! Fathers day is coming up soon if you want to give someone a really nice gift. HINT!!\\"
  1982. At first glance the Gillette... Seems like a complete solution for shaving and manscaping. I was at a lost at first to know how to use the razor with the battery powered clipper attachment. I didn't know whether to shave wet with shaving cream or dry as an electric razor. There were no specific directions. I tried it dry carefully on my face, neck and back with excellent results. The reach is exceptional. I could reach my back with no problems. The electronic clipper by itself works well on trimming side burns and around ears. While there are also other attachments for beard trimming, I personally don't find them useful bc I don't have a beard, but If I did, I might feel differently. However, I do like the size and ease of use of the battery powered trimmer. The clipper itself is worth the price of the set. It's perfect for traveling.

It is also very maneuverable along edges and around curves, which is a great thing. The trimmer is also shower safe, which is a nice feature though I did not use it in the shower. The Fusion ProGlide Styler gives you all the options you need to master your style. I'd give it a 9 out of 10.

  1996. I was one of the lucky people who received this trimmer free via a program offered by Gillette. After testing the razor for about a week I found the Gillette Power Trimmer is extremely easy to use, and with three heads, covers quite a bit of hair trimming for such a small trimmer. The battery life on this appears to be long lasting, which is always a good thing. The 3 heads that are provided allow for different uses and levels of trim, which allow it to be used all over, and not in one spot. I primarily used it for body trimming and to keep my sideburns in check, and this helped to make that job much easier and quicker than it has been in the past. One thing I do not much care for/recommend is using the general blade on this for shaving of the face. The handle is much to bulky compared with other razors to be used in that manner. For the general shaving of your face (minus trimming) I would use a normal Gillette razor. All in all, I would recommend this to anyone needing a trimmer.

  2023. I received the Gillette ProGlide Style Power Trimmer as part of a promotion and having used Mach3 razors and blades but never a power trimmer, I was anxious to try it out. The only other buzzer I have is the barber-shop variety--large and clunky. It's good for buzzing my head but the rest of it, no thanks. My job requires me to maintain a professional appearance (most of the time) so the chance to test this out was welcome.<br /><br />Enter the ProGlide Power Trimmer. My sideburns and around my ear needed some trimming and this thing was just the answer. It's size along allows you to maneuver it how you want and be way more specific with where you're trimming. Though I only used the \\"1\\" clip, the option to have three clips is great. For the little but of stubble on your face, it'll suffice but I don't think it'll chop through a four- or five-day growth.<br /><br />Washing it was a breeze--just flip the thing open and rinse it with warm water. Boom. I let mine sit laying down on a towel just to be safe.<br /><br />All you need is one AA battery and you're good to go--and it's included. Looking forward to my hair growing back quickly just so I can use this puppy again. Thanks Gillette for stepping up in the trimmer game!

  2034. This was provided to me free of charge through Gillette to try. When the product first arrived, I was impressed by the nice packaging and case. Upon initial inspection, I was happy to see that the trimmer also had a blade razor, and it had attachments for hair of different lengths. This is a very versatile product.<br /><br />I like how it came with a station for storage of the device and all its attachments. Upon use, I also noticed that changing attachments is simple, and the device itself is very maneuverable and nice looking. I liked how you could trim facial hair, sideburns, and virtually any other body hair.<br /><br />Some negatives: The trimmer blade does get hot after a short period of time, which can be a bit uncomfortable. Additionally, for my thick facial hair, the trimmer does nearly nothing and won't cut any stubble, including near my sideburns. I have a Norelco 1255x, and it is super smooth and quiet, and cuts right through coarse hair. The Gillette Fusion Proglide Trimmer is very loud and gives off a lot of vibration, which can be uncomfortable.<br /><br />My wife tried it on her arm hair, and the trimmer works better on her thin hair. The power fusion razor blade does not offer a noticeable advantage when shaving, it just seems to vibrate your hand, but not cut any better. Like other Fusion razors, cartridges are designed to wear out very fast with soft metal, forcing you to frequently purchase very pricey replacement cartridges. I used to only get 2-3 shaves out of a cartridge with a good shaving cream. I now only shave after showering (to soften the hair), and add shave oil underneath the cream, and the cartridges last about 5-6 shaves before being very dull.<br /><br />It is convenient to be able to have the trimmer included on the same device as the razor, making this a better travel or occasional use device. This is a great idea, and performs moderately well for the price point, but could use some improvement for it to be a true all-in-one device. Overall, a good value if you keep your expectations reasonable.
  2035. I received a free Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer via a program run by Gillette to tryout. After having tried out the product I want share the pros and cons<br /><br />The pros are as follows:<br />* It provides a good shave with an easy to snap on razor blade that will not pop-off like other shaving blades due to an advanced locking mechanism.<br />* The power trimmer fits perfectly in your hand with a comfortable grip.<br />* The edger blade is smaller than a hair trimmer and provides better styling around the ears and for the side burns. If you have a quasi-beard or several days' worth of stubble you can use the edger on your face to cut most of your long stubble away as not to dull the razor blade. The edger will also remove a full-fledged beard as well. The edger does not nick or cut your face. The edger is powerful enough and has an easy to push button.<br /><br />The cons are as follows:<br />* The trimmer function was poorly designed. You only have three trim guards that trim so close that you might as well just be buzzing off your beard, go-T, or mustache. The biggest guard trims so close you see through to the skin. Using the trimmer on your sider burns between haircuts is out of the question as you see through to the scalp. They should have made the trimmer guards to have longer lengths.

Really felt that the trimmer provided ample power to accomplish any facial trimming needs with precision. Have tried many other trimmers out there and they didnt provide the even cut of facial hairs that the power trimmer delivers. Good Bang for your Buck!!!!
  2083. I recently received a free Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer through a program that's run by Gillette, and I couldn't be happier with it. Up until now, I was using a Phillips Norelco Trimmer system that had different styling attachments which got the job done for the most part. However, it's been on it's last legs so the timing on receiving the new power trimmer was impeccable.<br /><br />Ok, so after trimming up the beard a few times with this bad boy I can safely say that this thing does a great job. It comes with three different trimming guides for different lengths, so you can really get the shave you're looking for. I've been using the #2, which is the middle size, and it cuts my beard to a perfect length. I also love that this thing is waterproof and has a good rubber grip to keep it in your hand even when wet. The whole thing comes with a convenient stand, which is nice because it keeps all the attachments perfectly stored. I also like that this it's battery powered. My Norelco had a rechargeable battery, but the worst was when it died on me mid shave. It wouldn't work while plugged in, so I had to wait to get a charge to finish the job or go out looking like a weirdo. Fortunately, I no longer have to worry about this since I can just pop in a new battery and be good to go.<br /><br />There are some things that I don't like about this trimmer though. First, it's kind of a pain to clean. The trimmer edge pushes back so you can wash out any hair that goes down inside, but there are a lot of pieces that just don't seem to want to come out. I've resorted to using a q-tip to get the stubborn stuff out, but even then it doesn't work all the time. Next, the only thing that's preventing me from getting rid of my Norelco at this point is the lack of a nose hair trimmer. Really wish that Gillette had made an attachment for this because it would be this the ideal replacement for a lot of trimmer systems out there.<br /><br />All in all, I found this to be a great little trimmer and was super ecstatic to receive one for free from Gillette!
  2084. I received the free Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer as part of a test program provided by Gillette and instantly new it was a winner.   2099. First off, huge thanks to Gillette for accepting me into one of their programs which allowed me to be a test agent for the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer! I've been a faithful Gillette man for nearly my entire adult life. And I plan to stay that way! My levels of excitement and anticipation majorly rose when I finally held the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer. The packaging is awesome!!! Very modern, almost \\"man chic\\", compact, and makes for secure travel/shipping. It definitely blows competitors out of the water with initial visual packaging and design. I like to do these tests without reading the provided directions, in order to test a product's intuitive nature. This bad boy is pretty intuitive! Nothing took me more than a minute or two to figure out. That being said, while I appreciate how well they package said bad boy, it took a little doing to get the actual parts out of their plastic casings. Thankfully, you can remove them all individually. And the complete outer packaging was amazingly simple! Remove tape, press two tabs in, pop open, and voila! Once out of the package, I LOVED the look of the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer as it sat on my bathroom shelving! It takes up hardly any space, and actually adds to the decor. On first unwrapped sight, I was a little worried about the smaller surface area of the trimmer not being able to do the job. But I reserved judgment for actual use. Fortunately, I really loved that everything fit in the sleek holster, there's no cumbersome charger to store elsewhere, and that the trimmer guards having their own hide-away section in the back! Now to get down to business! I have to put out there that I'm a medium-big, burly dude. So my man-scaping takes a lot more doing than a little bit of attention to kibbles and bits. If you're a smaller-built and/or less burly dude, I think the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer could work for your head-to-toe needs. For me, the smallersize of this trimmer made my larger-area man-scaping take 2-to-3 times a long as with other, larger trimmers. Because of this, I had to change my battery mid-scape (fortunately, all you have to do is twist the trimmer at the mid-point, and there ya go!). This took a few points away from the \\"no charger props\\" because I'll go through batteries more quickly than usual if I stick with the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer for full scaping. On the plus side, I found that the trimmer without the guard worked well even under wet conditions. The Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer doesn't come with a special trimmer/clipper brush...but I used a coarse hair brush to keep the blades clean, and had no problem. The guards were a different matter. I have to regrettably say that I didn't find the guards to work well. Hair became caught under them, it was difficult to remove said hair without shutting off the trimmer, removing the guard, and cleaning it. In the end, I had to resort to the other trimmer I had for my larger, more burly areas. That said, the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer is hands down the best kibbles and bits scaper I have ever used! Not one nick, scratch, bump, or moment of fear. There is no way I'm ever using another trimmer for those endeavors! Overall, I recommend the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer! I think it's all about your personal needs, build, burliness, and all that jazz. I'll definitely be using this as my sole \\"special\\" trimmer, and as a back-up if my other one needs charging mid-scape.

This is the perfect tool for anyone that enjoys keeping a sculpted beard or \\"manscaping.\\" The precision blade made clean, precise lines and allowed me to trim back some of the hair I did not did flattering. I would definitely recommend this product to a friend.

  2109. I received the Gillette® Fusion® ProGlide Styler packet from a free program by Gillette and have used it consistently since.<br />I have a full beard and a bald head. I typically keep it bald, but I wanted to put the Gillette Fusion Proglide Styler to the test. I did this in the shower my scalp soft and pliable. Then I attached the ProGlide Razor and finished the job with shaving cream. The new Proglide blades are definitely thinner and as I have sensitive skin, it didnt leave any irritation or skin burn feel after shaving, like the earlier fusion blades. Now, I know if I skip a day or two of shaving my head I can knock it back down with no irritation or pulling that some trimmers do.<br /><br />Enclosed with the trimmer are 3 different styling guide combs. I wanted to sculp the beard, and not get rid of it entirely. This tool is a basic, but solid trimmer. It is not going to cut 3\\" of beard by itself. I took a regular comb, and using it as a backer (like a barber would) used the trimmer with no attachment to take the beard down to a managable level. Then I used the #3 comb attached to take it to a beautiful 1\\" round and switched back to the normal trimmer to cut the hard lines of the beard (clean line on the neck and in with no effort at all).<br /><br />I also use it to manscape a bit lower. The Proglide Styler manages to knock everything very quickly and the Proglide Razor attachment takes care of the rest very quickly.<br /><br />I Actually dropped the trimmer twice by accident and love how durable the ProGlide Styler is and how easy it is to clean, as the blade pops right open and freely rinses.

  2111. I was provided a Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer by the company and asked to write a review. I like the water proof feature as it's very convenient to do my trimming while showering. It comes with three attachments of very appropriate lengths, runs off of a single AA battery and has surprising power. I've used rechargeable types which don't last as long from a single charge.<br /><br />I find it works real well at keeping the hair off my ears between hair cuts, trimming up my mustache, beard, eyebrows and the wonderful ear tufts that come with the onset of wisdom.<br /><br />I like to travel and it fits very nicely in my grooming bag.<br /><br />As with all devices there were a few of things I was not so happy with. The storage stand which if you don't have a nice large shelf in your shower really has no place to be. It would have been nice if they could have come up with an optional suction cup system for attaching it to the side of the shower. The packaging, there was probably more plastic there to be tossed out than there was in the trimmer itself. And lastly cleaning the trimmer. The instruction show just open it and run water through it. Well the shower has not had enough pressure to do that and I've found to really clean it I need to wait till it drys out and then use a small razor brush.<br /><br />Bottom line I like it. It's compact, cuts well and waterproof. You could even take it camping since you don't have to worry about a charging system and if you want to be green about it a rechargeable battery with a solar charger and you are all set.

  2134. I must admit I got this product from Gillette as part of a testing program. I love their products anyway, so I thought, 'what the heck!'. I was not disappointed. It tended to pull and not cut a smoothly as I would have liked; however, I don't trim my sideburns very often as my hair is long enough to cover it, so it wasn't a big deal. Overall, it's a great product, I like it, and would recommend any guy to at least give it a shot before dropping a small wad on a more expensive item.
  2135. The Pro Glider Trimmer by Gillette is a great idea. My wife usually uses electric clippers on me to trim my sideburns and ears etc., sometimes she uses scissors if she can't get close enough to trim everything. I flinch because the scissors are so close to my face which doesn't help. I have never used a trimmer like this before and I think it is great. It works nicely to shape my sideburns and trim my ears. It's a close shave. It's quiet so when it's near my ears it isn't too loud. I also like that it has it's own stand. It doesn't take up too much space in our small bathroom. It is also water proof if I want to use it in the shower. It uses regular size batteries, nothing special. I think it is a great product!
  2136. So, I got this razor as part of a free program run by Gillette. It came to my house a few weeks ago, right before I was supposed to head out for a date - fortuitous, right? Well, I tried it out while I was doing my pre-date maintenance ... and damned if it didn't work like a charm for me. I mean, the date sucked, but I felt good through it. It's a great, flexible trim for all of the hair I've got (and it's a lot of it); no nicks, no burns, no annoyances, just a good, close trim. It's easy to clean, and the attachments are the perfect length - I like to use one on the top half of my goatee and a smaller one for the bottom half. It works, trust me.   2138. I received Gillette's powered Fusion ProGlide razor as part of a trial program through Gillette for free and was very excited to try it out. The package came with 1 blade and 1 AA battery, as well as a stand and beard trimming attachments. In addition to being a razor, it is also a trimmer/ styler. The attachments come in 3 different lengths for trimming and simply clip on. This allows you to choose one geared specifically for the length you want. All accessories attach and disassemble very easily. The trimmer works great. It would work well for maintaining and cleaning up a goatee or other facial hair. The three variable lengths seem to be adequate for most facial hair lengths. The trimmer could easily be used on facial hair, ears, and back of neck. I highly recommend this trimmer for small jobs as it doesn't have the strength to go through thick hair. It is a great value.

  2144. I received the Fusion Proglide from a program run by Gillette, and I've been largely satisfied with it. It certainly didn't blow me away and there are several enhancements I would suggest, but it is a very competent and useful device.<br />I like that it provided a nifty little stand that sits gracefully on your bathroom counter, but there really isn't anything special about this product.<br /><br />Some cons:<br />1. It is rather bulky. The handle is disproportionately large, dwarfing the blade head. It looks rather comical, and it's not exceptionally comfortable to hold.<br />2. It has no nose/ear hair trimmer. The default styler is too wide to be of any use in those areas. For a razor that looks like a luxury tool, I would like more functionality out of it.<br />3. It is powered by a AA battery. If the razor's stand could recharge a built-in battery, the razor would be more remarkable.<br /><br />It's by no means a bad product, but that same amount of money would be better spent on a more basic Gillette razor and replacement blades.

  2147. Full disclosure up front: I received this product for free through a promotional program run by Gillette. That being said, I was in the market for a beard trimmer/body grooming tool, and due to past positive experiences with Gillette products, would likely have tried the Fusion ProGlide Styler regardless of being selected for the free program.<br /><br />The overall design of the product is quite nice. The handle is light and fits nicely in the hand. I also like that the product attempts to be an all-in-one solution, allowing you to shave, trim, and edge with a single device. Would be a great solution when traveling, especially when considering there is not a separate power cord to be packed since it runs off a single battery.<br /><br />Over the past few weeks, I have used all of the functions of the Styler. I performs well as an edging device, cleaning up my sideburns easily. I was also pleased with the beard trimmer, which worked well and did not irritate my skin or feel like it was pulling at the hairs in my face. I also did a test of using the Styler to trim my chest hair and found that it was easy and effective as a body grooming device in this capacity. The ProGlide Styler also allows you to attach a Fusion razor blade for standard shaving. This was the only function that I felt the Styler was not great for, as the size of the handle and length when using with the razor blade attachment did not feel comfortable to me and prevented me from getting as good a shave as when using my standard razor. For someone using this at home, I would recommend using a standard razor for shaving and using the Styler solely as a trimmer/edger.<br /><br />In general I was happy with the Fusion ProGlide Styler. I would recommend it to someone who was looking for a cost-effective beard trimmer or body groomer. I would also recommend highly for anyone traveling who was looking for a simple all-in-one device to take with them. I am taking away one star from my review due to the awkwardness of using the Styler for shaving purposes, but again, think this could be overlooked if I was using this on the road instead of in my home where I have my standard razor.

  2155. [DISCLOSURE] I received this razor free through a program from Gillette. I am generally an electric user - I last used a blade back in the days when 3 blades was considered extreme. Razor technology seems to have come a long way. 5 blades does shave faster than 3, and the vibration gives it a soothing feel. (I'm not sure it buys you much as far as a closer shave.) In general I still prefer an electric. I just cut myself too often with a blade. Maybe I'm just a klutz. Still, for the price difference between this and an electric, the shave is comparable. The trimmer attachments seem to work well, and I love the idea of only having one device, but I didn't use them much. My wife doesn't want me to tinker with my facial hair.<br /><br />I did have one big gripe with it, however. I found the handle to be quite anti-ergonomic when holding the razor in a non-vertical position. For example, when shaving under my chin, the grip I used caused a fair bit of fatigue in my hand. Because of this, I would use this razor in a pinch, but likely would not make it my full-time shaver. The advantage of the vibration, for me, doesn't offset the need to make the handle so thick and stocky to accommodate the battery.

  2179. A little about my face. I have a mustache with a goatee, with fairly coarse and thick hair. I typically will let it grow for a few weeks, then will use a beard trimmer to get it down a bit, before using a shaving trimmer to get even closer, before attempting a shave.<br /><br />With that said, I received the Gillette Fusion Proglide Styler as a promotion from Gillette. I first pulled out the package and looked it over, looking to charge it for the first use, but found nothing to connect. Then I realized, there was already a AA battery inside the unit, so it came ready to go. Since my beard is fairly long, I wasn't sure the trimmer guards would work well, but still wanted to give it a go.<br />I didn't start with a beard trimmer trim first, and dove straight in. The Proglide Styler didn't pull or tug on any of the hairs, but cut right through. Sometimes I'll have to do a double pass to get everything, but no such issues here either. While it didn't get as close as my normal shaving trimmer might, it definitely got much closer than a beard trimmer(which is half of the time, where I leave my shaving sessions due to time).<br />I did try the guards, when trimming the lengths of the mustache against a comb and freehand, but that didn't work so well. There's the three lengths, but they are all far too short for my current setup. Using them as intended, I have no doubts they would perform as expected.<br /><br />Connecting/disconnecting of the attachments was very simple, the button on the back for removal of the attachments is well designed. It won't accidentally pop off(like others I've used), but will easily when done on purpose. The power button is flush with the Styler, so it's unobtrusive, but at the same time easy to find.<br />I almost didn't find that the top flipped open to clean. It could have been a little easier to clean, especially when wet, but overall not bad at all. I think a detached head, or an included brush, would have done wonders.<br /><br />The design of the device, almost simplistic while an eye on usability, really makes this a great product. There could be some improvements, but they are minor and more personal preference I'm sure. It looks manly, without the weight and harshness that typically comes with \\"manly\\" products.

  2181. Aesthetics:<br /><br />Beginning with the packaging, I have to say that I was even more excited about this product once I learned that it is manufactured, at least in part, by Braun. I opened the package easily and found many pieces, of which I knew what they were, but did not know how to place them in the stand or attach to the unit. You won't lose your hearing with a trim. The cutting blade is small and allows for intricate sculpting in areas of the beard, sideburns, or anywhere else you may choose to use this. I was skeptical about trimming my goatee with this unit because I have only had mediocre experiences with grooming tools that are not commonly used in barber shops / hair salons. I added the #1 guard to the trimmer and began to shave. I was THOROUGHLY impressed. The razor glided through my relatively thick beard and never snagged. If there's one thing I hate, it's when a hair gets painfully yanked out from the root. Because this is a battery powered unit, I was able to trim my beard in a much shorter period of time. So far so good.<br /><br />The 5 blade razor attachment for a regular shave worked out exceptionally well too. I never had a razor that vibrated, but the feel and the way it glides over the skin made a very smooth shave, and I have had no irritation whatsoever.<br /><br />If I had to find fault with anything, I would only say that perhaps the instructions on how to store each piece could be better. Some people may have difficulty understanding how to store the pieces. That said, when all of the pieces are installed, the unit is small enough that I actually have the entire thing on a shelf in my medicine cabinet. I might also suggest an attachment for nose/ear hair trimming. I'd pay an extra $5 to get that in the package.<br /><br />Overall Opinion / Rating:<br /><br />I am relieved and excited to now have a razor for trimming and shaving that I can take anywhere and that performs well beyond expectations. This is a product that is in no way to be considered disposable or cheap. I plan to use it as long as possible. Hats off the the designers and engineers.

  2203. I have been a 3-blade razor user since the Gillette Mach 3 came out. I have sensitive skin and often get knicks and pulls that leave my face feeling irritated. I cannot tell you if that was what caused me to grow a beard, or if it was just a fashion statement. When I recieved the free Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer through a special offer with Gillete, I decided I would put it to the test and get the full effect of this new razor... the beard had to go. I used the Power Trimmer with the 2-guard attachment to groom the entire beard down. This was a very power tool and much less bulky than the full clippers I was previously using. I then decided to have some fun and try out the trimming functionality, so I shaved most of the beard completely off. I was very pleased by the smoothness of the shave and didn't get the pulls and knicks that I was used to with my previous razor. My wife was not as impressed as I was by my fu manchu, but in all honesty the trimmer cut clean lines and it was easy to shape a unique mustache.<br /><br />For those of you that have facial hair or conduct any regular man-scaping. I would highly recommend the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer. My only complaint is that my beard is gone. My wife likes the clean shaved look, so it will stay for now.<br /><br />As an added bonus, I have used the vibrating handle while shaving and you get the feel of an electric razor with the closeness of a real blade.

I was trying to put the razor back in the holder after using it the first night and right away the thing fell in the shower and all the parts fell all over the shower floor. If you like to use your razor at the sink or plan on keeping the razor and accessories at the sink and just taking the razor back and forth to the shower, the holder would be great for you. You could also find another way to store this in the shower if you wanted to. Other than the holder, I thought this was a great trimmer!

  2219. I was lucky enough to get a free Gillette Fusion Proglide Styler Power Trimmer to try for a while. I'm a picky shaver and have long felt the technology in blades was a waste of my money. I was happy with a good quality two blade razor but I wanted to know if the latest and greatest from Gillette would change my mind. Well, the trimmer showed up and I was immediately impressed with the quality of the packaging, presentation and equipment.<br />I'd been holding off on a goatee trim for about a week in anticipation. My first reaction was this little trimmer is no match for the corded trimmer I usually use to trim up the facial hair but I was wrong! It felt great in my hand and had plenty of power to glide through my course hair. I really liked the fence was well since it didn't clog up, glided smoothly across my face and came with three different heights. I think I've got a new favorite trimmer.<br />Next, I jumped into the shower to get a good shave. I stood there for a minute and re-read the box to make sure everything was water safe and sure enough it all is. Looking at the mess I made in my sink I should have trimmed the goatee in the shower too. Anyway, The shave head for this thing is a bit scary. It's got 5 blades and a back blade for tight lines and uses the trimmer's head to create a vibrating blade. Immediately I noticed that the handle, while small for a trimmer, is quite large for a razor. It would take some getting used to and I had a hard time getting a feel for my face. I ended up turning the vibrating portion off to get the feel and let the 5 blades do the work by themselves. It's a really smooth shave and the blades do a great single pass job and the lubricating strip works as it should. I tried the back blade on the edges of my side burns and it works great but its not something I feel I've been missing all these years.<br />So here's my bottom line. This is a really great trimmer and a functional razor that will take some getting used to. For me, the trimmer alone would be worth a purchase but I think I'll stick to my old razor. If you love technology in a razor and look for the smoothest and best shave then you can't do any better than this. But first, think about the feel of your razor in your hand and if you think something 3x as large will be a problem, this isn't the razor for you. For me, I'm going to use it travelling when I don't want to carry multiple grooming devices.

My mustache grows faster and causes an awkward balance. The middle of my chin also darkens up quicker than the rest of the beard in a way that makes me look kinda like Wolverine. And I grow an unsightly neck beard.<br />The last problem can be easily fixed with my disposable razor, but the other two are almost impossible to change.<br /><br />Then I got this Styler/Trimmer for free as part of a program run by Gillette and it makes me enjoy my facial hair again. Before, I would shave completely and look like a baby alien for a few days, and then have a few glorious days of good rough, but not scruffy. However, after that, I deal with uneven hair.<br /><br />The device fits perfectly in my hand and is easily maneuverable; I never felt that it would slip out of my hands ever, and it actually feels very sturdy. I did not grow out my hair long enough to use the larger sizes, but I can tell that they are definitely varied and the smallest one is perfect for having a nice amount of stubble. I did have to go over some spots on my face repeatedly and I noticed that hair would litter my entire sink and even get caught in a small space underneath the razor edges, but both were easily cleaned. I would definitely recommend getting this product.

It could get the job done, in a pinch, but it took much longer. If I only had a goatee that I kept relatively short, I'm confident that this device could more than take care of it. As far as the trimming I usually like to keep the designer stubble look or have a very low trimmed beard.<br />Only issue I came across was when I was cutting back on a thick beard, it took me multiple swipes in the same location to get it to the level I wanted. I was using the #1 and it was tiresome. It works a lot better on if you're keeping up with your shaving and trimming needs on the daily.<br />As far as the trimmer goes without any of the attachments, it is fantastic; unfortunately the attachments really drag down the score for me and left me a bit disappointed.<br />It's a great product, and if you use it as I mentioned then you won't need to spend any more money.   2360. Sooo where do I start? They don't cut well, you have to go over areas multiple times, and quite frankly they feel cheaply made. Electric and waterproof? Awesome!! It's grippy so you won't drop it, it feels sturdy, runs off 1 AA Battery which is cost effective, vibrates while you shave, and uses disposable proglide cartridges for getting that close shave!<br /><br />Now I have never had a styler/trimmer that not only trimmed, but could also SHAVE. I no longer need a razor, AND a trimmer; I have them both in one here. That is too cool. Having a woman in the house, the bathroom space is scarce enough with all of her \\"tools\\" on it, so being able to get 1 less thing out of the way and this also being as compact as it is, is just too ideal.<br /><br />The power button lights up with a cool little LED, just for a little \\"cool factor\\". Granted this trimmer comes with only 3 hair setting pieces (which all fit into the little base in the back), as opposed to 5 or more from other trimmers I have used, I find that most guys including myself only use 1 of the hair settings or maybe 2 at most.<br /><br />The other thing, is that it's SUPER easy to clean!! The other ones I have used, I'd have to get a screwdriver, take off the plate, and then clean it with the brush, just meddlesome. Why should it be as complicated as that? It doesn't. I don't have to bother with any screwdrivers with this one, which is very convenient. I don't know how it handles with long hair, but I never have to goover an area twice on my face, it cuts easy.<br /><br />This trimmer, ESPECIALLY for the price, can't be topped. It was made with quality, convenience, style, and bargain in mind. And to top it off, I received this for free from Gillette just to give my feedback on it. Thank you Gillette!

  2443. For the price, I haven't used a better electric trimmer. Keep in mind, there are better ones out there, but nothing that doesn't cost an arm and a leg.<br /><br />PROs:<br />+Works well. Not super powerful, but good enough to trim away a full beard.<br />+Comes with 3 blade combs, which all work well.<br />+The included base actually works great for storing the trimmer and all attachments, unlike many other trimmer kits I've bought, which the attachments just sit loosely in a tray. The blades store firmly in the back side of the stand and don't fall out.<br />+Easy to clean. The head can be \\"unlocked\\" to tap out hair clippings, but do not do what the instructions say and wash it in water! Even though the blades are \\"stainless steel\\", they WILL corrode. Use a good trimmer lubricant to keep them clean, sharp, and rust-free.<br />+Has a nice, solid feel to it. Doesn't seem cheaply-made and has a good grip.<br /><br />CONs:<br />-Rather loud for it's size. Use a good trimmer lubricant to cut down on the noise. Can't use it in the early AM while the lady is still sleeping.<br />-Wish it came with one extra blade comb that's just a bit longer. The 3 included combs are pretty short.<br />-Uses AA batteries instead of a built-in rechargeable.<br />-The shaving attachment is worthless. Do it right and just use a manual shaving razor. Trying to shave using the attachment is just cumbersome. Imagine trying to shave with a banana. The nice thing is that the shaving blade is the same as the Gillette Fusion series, so you can just pop the included blade on to your regular Fusion razor.<br /><br />CONCLUSION:<br />Even though I received this trimmer for free via a promotion run by Gillette, I would DEFINITELY buy one for the $20 MSRP. As soon as I used this trimmer for a few days, I threw out my old Wahl trimmer kit. You won't be disappointed with this one!

  2481. So, I received my fusion pro-glide styler and since I usually sport a little goatee I was excited and optimistic that this product would come in quite handy. And I got it free from a program run by Gillette, so bonus.<br /> When I first opened the package was impressed with the stand and the storage of the length combs, it makes for a nice little footprint on the bathroom counter. When I first used the trimmer I was pretty impressed by the ergonomics. It's the perfect size to trim the lines of your face, that little divot on my chin and the laugh lines that form the mustache are no trouble. As for the length combs, I didn't really have much use for them personally, but I do like the way they clip on to the trimmer. One HUGE plus and what sets the fusion pro-glide apart is how easy it is to clean. The click open and wash out cleaning can't get any better. Such a big advantage that I haven't seen from any other trimmer out there. Next is the ability to attach the razor to this trimmer, another aspect that I haven't seen, this makes the pro-glide styler the only product you need for your trimming shaving needs. Now, I had never used a power razor before and I thought they were kind of a gimmick, but I have been proven incorrect. With my sensitive skin the vibration helps glide the pro-glide across my toughest shaving spots and I am a convert to the power razor from here on out.<br /> Ok now for the places that could be improved on, I travel a good bit for work and it would be great if a small travel bag was included. Put this in my suitcase and when I got to where I was going I had to search for the combs and razor head attachments. To have a little bag to put this in would be great.<br />Next, this is truly just a trimmer, do not try and cut a full on beard clean with this, I did and it just didn't have the power to cut the thick hair without pulling and bogging down. This is for facial, at home maintenance, not a hedge clipper for the big jobs.<br />Finally, as with all the razors you buy today really, would it kill you to include even one replacement cartage for the razor? It takes a little time to get use to a new razor and you're not giving us any replacements to keep us with your razor for any amount of time.<br />So all in all, a few minor annoyances but this is my new, all in one, grooming system. Now I just need to go buy more razors for it.

  2487. I received the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler from a program run by Gillette. With the various attachments and convenient size, the Proglide is a wonderful tool that works on even the hardest face. I was able to trim my rather thick beard with minimal effort. The only downside I saw in the product is the packaging that the Styler is in. The product is placed rather securely in the package making it difficult to get out. It also is difficult to change heads at first, but these negatives are far outweighed by the positives such as the ease of trimming, the obvious way to tell if the blades need changed (the strip above the blades will turn to white as it is used up), and the smooth feeling left behind. This product would be highly recommended.
  2488. I was selected by Gilette to participate in a program they were running to review new products, and received it in the mail a few weeks ago. I was curious to see if the Fusion Proglide's trimmer would beat the experience of using a typical beard-trimmer that I use for most of my 'manscaping'. After using it about a dozen times in various capacities, I have to state that the answer to this is an unequivocal \\"yes!\\" I'll cover the ways I used it, and how it performed in each of them:<br /><br />First, I like to keep the stubbled look on my face, and until now have used a beard-trimmer, without any guard over the teeth to knock back my stubble every few days. This works, but it can pull at the longer whiskers pretty painfully, and you have to go pretty slow. With the Fusion Proglide neither of these is an issue. Without using any of the provided guards and just using the trimmer I was able to achieve the look I was going for, and after using it several times I am yet to have it cause a single pulled whisker, and can go at any speed I would like.<br /><br />I also used it to edge my side-burns and keep them neatly trimmed as well. Again in this regard the trimmer performs admirably. The lines at the bottom are crisp and clean, and with the guards I can trim the hair a bit shorter if I would like. No complaints on the performance here either!<br /><br />Finally, as far as man-scaping goes, I like to keep things clean shaven, especially on my chest and stomach, but often go a couple weeks between trimmings. I could use a razor right from the start, but if the hair has grown too long the razor ends up needing to be rinsed after every single stroke, and on top of that it's not a very close shave with this method. By using the pro-glide trimmer first on whatever area I'm shaving this problem is eliminated, and the shaving goes much faster and the result is much smoother. The pro-glide trimmer can be used on pretty much any area you can imagine.<br /><br />As for howit performs in the shower or out of the shower, I was skeptical at first that the shower performance would be just as good as using it dry. In the end though it performs literally just as well in both situations, I notice no drop-off in quality of trim when using it in the shower, and the wet stubble does not clog it up at all. Cleaning is easy, the trimmer head pops up and can easily be cleaned out in about 10 seconds.<br /><br />My only gripe, and it's a small one, is that the trimmer gets somewhat hot if you use it for several minutes. It's not burning by any means, but can get a tad uncomfortable if you have it pressed to your skin for a few seconds for some reason, if it has been on for several minutes. This is only an issue for maybe the final 5% of the time you're trimming, and only if it's been a particularly long session.<br /><br />So in conclusion this product did everything I needed it to, did it well, and performed equally superb in both wet and dry conditions. GREAT product
  2489. I received the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer from a free program run by Gillette. I was honestly hesitant to try it, because my skin is typically extremely sensitive to shaving or trimming to any kind. I am so glad I did, because it worked great! No razor burn or bumps left behind - only a great trim!<br /><br />Due to my job, I shave my face every day... so using the trimmer to get to hard to reach areas was easy for me. However when I tried to trim other body hair, I had some instances where the styler actually pulled my hair - that is to be somewhat expected for such a small razor and long hair. For maintaining a trim or different style, I think that it is an amazing piece of equipment. I would definitely recommend it to a friend.
  2490. Best trimmer for the price. Mine has been running strong for quite some time now. Recommended.
  2491. My husband received this trimmer/razor free via a program from Gillette. Once it is dry you add a drop of trimmer oil if needed. He likes the convenience of not having to charge it with a cord every few days. He has been using it daily for almost 3 weeks and it is still running strong on the original AA battery.<br /><br />Con:<br />The trim heads are made of a hard plastic and do look like they might break easily if dropped. so he is extra careful with it, especially in the shower.<br /><br />Overall, a great product!

  2499. I received the Gillette Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer through a program run by Gillette.   2521. Full disclaimer: I'm a hairy guy. I saw the ads and after receiving a ProGlide Styler via a Gillette promo, I was hopeful that it would help me rein in my mane. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to expectations.<br /><br />The Good:<br />It feels solid, not overly bulky, and I never lost my grip when using the trimmer. It edges well, helping to keep sideburns even and a beard line straight. The heads swap out easily enough and it was relatively easily to clean.<br /><br />The Bad:<br />The holder is a little weak. It comes across as flimsy and I find myself holding the holder to take out different guards and the trimmer itself; otherwise, it falls over when I attempt to quickly grab it. The battery also wears down when handling long trimming jobs. When attempting to shave, it was cumbersome; the complete opposite of when using it as a trimmer. I felt as though the handle and length of ProGlide Styler kept me from holding my face's contours as well as my regular razor. The shave wasn't as close and I actually ended up nicking myself on more than one occasion.<br /><br />The Ugly:<br />It does a poor, poor job of handling longer hair. If you're looking for a trimmer to handle long beards, curly chest hair, or buzz longer hair, think again. This is not the product for you. Because of the small head on the trimmer, I found this tool to be very inefficient, requiring me to go over the same area multiple times in order to actually trim hair. It did not matter if the hair was dry or wet; same result.<br /><br />I'd recommend this product only if you need a trimmer for precision, i.e., a goatee, beard line, sideburns, etc. If you're looking for anything more, or a total body trimmer, keep looking.

  2549. I heard about the Gillette Fusion Proglide not too long ago and was invited to try the product by receiving a free razor provided by a program run by Gillette. At first glance, the packaging is great. It has an awesome little encasement inside that makes it easy to store away the buzzer and its accessories.<br />I tend to use another buzzer in the home when I'm too lazy to completely shave my beard. This groomer has replaced that buzzer. I like to have a little bit of stubble on my face instead of being completely smooth. Using the buzzer is a breeze. It's easy, its ergonomic, and it's very easy to manipulate to get straight lines when grooming your beard.<br />When in use for a little over 2-3 minutes, the buzzer starts to warm up a little bit. This must be because of the small compact size and the constant motion of the blade on top.<br />The attachments are a cool feature but when I tried to shave with it, it felt weird. This may be because I'm used to using an electric razor but the attachment is a welcome addition. I like the option to not completely buzz the beard to small stubble by adding a comb to it.<br />Overall, for $20 this buzzer is unmatched. It's cheap, durable, and does what it claims. I would recommend this product to anyone who needs a cheap groomer for on the go.
  2550. I received a free razor through a Gillette Promotion.   2552. I have had some type of facial hair for over twenty years - beards, goatees, and even a short stint with a mustache (yet, too long from what my family tells me). In that time I have had multiple beard trimmers and groomers to keep me looking my best. I was lucky enough to get a free trimmer from Gillette and I have to say that I was really surprised at how much I liked the Fusion ProGlide Styler Power Trimmer.<br /><br />There is a lot to like. The handle feels solid. It has a great nonslip grip and it is the size is perfect. Not too big, but not to small so that it takes too long to trim the beard. I have always had trouble trimming the area between my upper lip and my nose. Most beard trimmers and guards were bulky and wouldnt trim the hairs below the nose. This groomer worked perfectly. It's also really easy to clean. There are no minuscule screws to worry about. It flips open and snaps shut. But the best part is that I can use it in the shower - no more hairs flying all over the bathroom counter and floor.<br /><br />I have been trying to think of something that I didn't like or that I would change in the product with no luck. For the price, I think it is a steal. I would absolutely buy another one of these trimmers should this one stop working.
  2553. I'd had my eye on this product for a while and was thrilled to be selected by Gillette to receive it for free and to review it. First, I've always been an electric razor guy. I have light hair and sparse facial hair so an electric razor has always been easiest for me. As I've gotten older it has been tougher to keep up with the stubble. I figured it was worth trying the Fusion Proglide to see if it worked any better. Plus, the styler for a little manscaping was a necessary tool for me.<br /><br />The razor has been great, I have been really impressed. Is it more work than electric, sure it is. But my face is smoother and the vibration has cut down on razor burn which has always been a big problem for me. The shave is so close that I can very easily go two days between shaves. If it's really necessary, I will just use the electric on the in-between days. Overall, I'm glad I tried it and will continue to use the razor.<br /><br />The styler tool has also worked better than any alternatives. First, I can get at those hairs that grow on the outside of the ear. One buzz once and week and no more stragglers. Throw on the guards and I take care of those unwanted hairs in unmentionable places. It's much easier, and must less nerve-wracking than scissors. And let's just say the work was noticed and appreciated.<br /><br />Very happy with the product and would recommend highly.
